Headline: : 3M Launches New Format of Confirm Authentication Products with Floating Image Technology
Story: - New format of popular security product allows for new                            applications -  ST. PAUL, Minn.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 02, 2007--     3M today announced the launch of a new format of the 3M Confirm  authentication products with floating image technology that helps to  protect against counterfeiting and tampering. This new format offers  multi-layered overt and covert security features, and allows for the  incorporation of additional security and tracking features into the  same label.     First introduced last April as the latest in a line of innovative security solutions, the Confirm authentication products with floating image technology from 3M feature an optically variable device (OVD) - a unique, overt security feature. The OVD image appears to "float" above or "sink" below the surface of the label and then disappear as the viewing angle changes, which enhances the brand with a visually attractive "wow" factor. Dramatic movement of the image is easy to detect and recognize using only the human eye, enabling quick and easy authentication that helps to prove the label and product are genuine.     "This fully customizable strip is ideal for any market segments that are known victims of counterfeiting or fraud, such as major branded electronics, automotive parts, apparel or pharmaceuticals," said Bill Markovitz, marketing development manager, 3M Security Systems Division. "The additional functionality of the new format allows manufacturers, wholesalers and retailers to use just one label for easy authentication, bar codes, tracking and other additional security features, which cuts costs and increases efficiency and security."     The new format builds on 3M's proven retroreflective security technology - 3M Confirm security labels - which have been very well accepted in the security marketplace for more than 25 years. The floating image security feature enhances the inherent security of Confirm authentication labels and is based on 3M proprietary technology. Verification is easier than ever and can be accomplished by a diverse population.     For more than 30 years, 3M has provided premier security solutions and services that identify, authenticate, secure and track materials and information by combining security and productivity. Drawing on its broad technology base and expertise, 3M creates solutions for a wide array of security needs. Examples include issuance and authentication of travel documents and personal identification cards, brand and asset protection solutions to fight counterfeiting and tampering, file tracking solutions, and library security and workflow management solutions.       About 3M - A Global, Diversified Technology Company     Every day, 3M people find new ways to make amazing things happen. Wherever they are, whatever they do, the company's customers know they can rely on 3M to help make their lives better. 3M's brands include Scotch, Post-it, Scotchgard, Thinsulate, Scotch-Brite, Filtrete, Command and Vikuiti. Serving customers in more than 200 countries around the world, the people of 3M use their expertise, technologies and global strength to lead in major markets including consumer and office; display and graphics; electronics and telecommunications; safety, security and protection services; health care; industrial and transportation. For more information, including the latest product and technology news, visit www.3M.com.       3M, Confirm, Scotch, Post-it, Scotchgard, Thinsulate,  Scotch-Brite, Filtrete, Command and Vikuiti are trademarks of 3M.        CONTACT: LVM Group Inc.               James T. Kimer, 212-499-6571               james@lvmgroup.com               or               3M Public Relations               Connie S. Thompson, 651-733-8914               http://www.3m.com/PressContact        SOURCE: 3M  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 11:01 ET (16:01 GMT)

Headline: CFA IPO Spotlight: BigBand Networks Prospectus Info
Story: BigBand Networks Inc. on Dec. 22 filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission an initial public offering of up to $140 million in common stock. The following is a summary of the IPO prospectus provided to the SEC.    THE COMPANY   Big Band Networks, of Redwood City, Calif., develops platforms that enable cable operators and telephone companies to offer video, voice and data services across networks. Its customers have included Cablevision Systems Corp. (CVC), Charter Communications Inc. (CHTR), Comcast Corp. (CMCSA, CMCSK), Time Warner Cable Inc. and Verizon Communications Inc. (VZ).    OFFERING INFORMATION   BigBand Networks didn't disclose how many shares will be offered and didn't provide an estimated price range for the shares.   The company said it intends to use the net proceeds from the IPO to repay about $14 million in debt and for working capital, capital expenditures, acquisitions and other general corporate purposes.   Listed as underwriters for the IPO are Morgan Stanley & Co. Inc., Merrill Lynch & Co., Pierce, Fenner & Smith Inc., Jefferies & Co. Inc., Cowen & Co. LLC and ThinkEquity Partners LLC.   The company said it plans to list its stock on the Nasdaq Global Market under the symbol BBND.    EARNINGS                                           Nine Months Ended                                               Sept. 30                                          2006            2005  Revenue                             $113,622,000     $71,248,000  Gross profit                         $57,447,000     $26,843,000  Operating income                      $1,405,000    ($17,715,000)  Net income                              ($66,000)   ($19,728,000)   Figures in parentheses are losses.   As of Sept. 30, BigBand Networks had an accumulated deficit of $120.24 million, according to the prospectus.    GROWTH STRATEGY   BigBand Networks said its objective is to be the leading provider of network-based products that enable the delivery of high-bandwidth, high-quality video, voice and data services and more effective video advertising.   The company said it aims to expand its "footprint" within its existing customer base and expand its customer base regardless of the access technology different customers use.   BigBand Networks said it will collaborate with customers to continue developing next-generation advertising. The company said it is in field trials with a leading cable operator for the delivery of ads tailored down to the level of individual subscribers.    RISK FACTORS   BigBand Networks said risk factors include the limited number of potential customers for its products and its limited history of profitability.   If the demand for video services from telephone companies doesn't grow as expected or if service providers find other methods of delivering video services, BigBand Networks' future sales of video products will suffer, the company said.   The company's results may fluctuate because BigBand Networks has a lengthy, complex and unpredictable sales cycle.   BigBand said its accountants have identified material weaknesses in the company's controls over financial reporting related to revenue recognition and financial statement closure.    MANAGEMENT  Name                  Age   Position  Amir Bassan-Eskenazi  42    president, chief executive and chairman  Frederick Ball        44    senior vice president and chief financial officer   Bassan-Eskenazi co-founded the company in 1998 and has served as its president, CEO and chairman since that time.   Ball has served as senior vice president and chief financial officer since August 2004.  Shareholder                   Cmn Shrs      Before Offer %   After Offer %  Funds affiliated with   Redpoint Ventures L.P.       36,780,930        N/A              N/A  ADC Telecommunications Inc.   32,111,772        N/A              N/A  Funds affiliated with   Charles River Partners L.P.  29,218,758        N/A              N/A  Funds affiliated with   Meritech Capital             17,482,364        N/A              N/A  Funds affiliated with   Evergreen Partners L.P.      16,677,245        N/A              N/A  Funds affiliated with   Pilot House Ventures         15,680,459        N/A              N/A  Funds affiliated with   Cedar Funds                  11,990,381        N/A              N/A    LIQUIDITY AND CAPITAL RESOURCES   As of Sept. 30, BigBand Networks had cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities of $40.05 million, according to the IPO prospectus.   The company has a $30 million credit facility. As of Sept. 30, $14 million was outstanding under the facility.     -Antonie Boessenkool, Dow Jones Newswires; 202-862-7139; antonie.boessenkool@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 13:43 ET (18:43 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : S&P Affirms American Performance Funds Rtg
Story: The following is a press release from Standard & Poor's:     NEW YORK (Standard & Poor's) Jan. 2, 2007--Standard & Poor's Ratings Services said today that it affirmed its 'AAAm' principal stability fund rating, the highest assigned to money market funds, on the American Performance Cash Management Fund and the American Performance U.S. Treasury Fund.   Effective today, the American Performance Institutional Cash Management Fund (rated 'AAAm' since Dec. 3, 2002) was merged with and into the American Performance Cash Management Fund and the American Performance Institutional U.S. Treasury Fund was merged with and into the American Performance U.S. Treasury Fund (rated 'AAAm' since Sept. 4, 1990). Due to the merger, the 'AAAm' rating that was assigned to the American Performance Institutional U.S. Treasury Fund since Dec. 6, 2000, has been withdrawn.   The American Performance Funds are managed by AXIASM Investment Management Inc. (AXIA), an SEC-registered investment adviser and a wholly-owned subsidiary of Bank of Oklahoma N.A., a bank subsidiary of BOK Financial Corp., a multibank holding company. AXIA offers investment management services to mutual funds and institutions and individuals, both taxable and tax exempt, through equity, fixed income, and cash management strategies. AXIA currently has approximately $5.3 billion in assets under management. The American Performance Funds are distributed by BISYS Fund Services L.P.   The 'AAAm' rating on the funds is based on our analysis of the funds' credit quality, market price exposure, and management. The rating signifies extremely strong capacity to maintain principal value and limit exposure to principal losses due to credit, market, and/or liquidity risks. This is accomplished through conservative investment practices and strict internal controls. We monitor rated money market fund portfolios weekly.   Primary Credit Analyst: Peter Rizzo, New York (1) 212-438-5059;                  peter_rizzo@standardandpoors.com Secondary Credit Analyst: Joel C Friedman, New York (1) 212-438-5043;                    joel_friedman@standardandpoors.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 10:19 ET (15:19 GMT)

Headline: : OSI Pharmaceuticals to Present at the 25th Annual JPMorgan Healthcare Conference on Tuesday, January 9, 2007
Story: MELVILLE, N.Y.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 02, 2007--   OSI Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (NASDAQ: OSIP) announced today that Colin Goddard Ph.D., Chief Executive Officer of OSI Pharmaceuticals will present at the JPMorgan Healthcare Conference in San Francisco, CA on Tuesday, January 9, 2007 at 10:00am Pacific Time (1:00pm Eastern Time). Dr. Goddard will provide an overview on the Company's product portfolio and business developments.     The presentation will be webcast live and may be accessed by visiting OSI's website at www.osip.com. A replay of the webcast will also be available on the Company's website until January 24, 2007.       About OSI Pharmaceuticals     OSI Pharmaceuticals is committed to "shaping medicine and changing lives" by discovering, developing and commercializing high-quality and novel pharmaceutical products designed to extend life and/or improve the quality of life for patients with cancer and diabetes/obesity. The Company's oncology programs are focused on developing molecular targeted therapies designed to change the paradigm of cancer care. OSI's diabetes/obesity efforts are committed to the generation of novel, targeted therapies for the treatment of type 2 diabetes and obesity. OSI's flagship product, Tarceva(R) (erlotinib), is the first drug discovered and developed by OSI to obtain FDA approval and the only EGFR inhibitor to have demonstrated the ability to improve survival in both non-small cell lung cancer and pancreatic cancer patients in certain settings. OSI markets Tarceva through partnerships with Genentech, Inc. in the United States and with Roche throughout the rest of the world. For additional information about OSI, please visit (http://www.osip.com).     This news release contains forward-looking statements. These statements are subject to known and unknown risks and uncertainties that may cause actual future experience and results to differ materially from the statements made. Factors that might cause such a difference include, among others, the completion of clinical trials, the FDA and other foreign review processes and other governmental regulation, OSI's and its collaborators' abilities to successfully develop and commercialize drug candidates, competition from other pharmaceutical companies, the ability to effectively market products, and other factors described in OSI Pharmaceuticals' filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission. Headline: Radnor Holdings Seeks To End Lease On HQ, Pact With CEO
Story: By Peg Brickley     DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     Radnor Holdings Inc. is asking bankruptcy court permission to jettison its employment pact with founder and chief executive Michael T. Kennedy, as well as its $557,000-a-year headquarters in the Philadelphia suburbs.   New court documents list Kennedy's employment deal and the headquarters lease among a series of contracts that Radnor Holdings wants to cancel.   California private-equity investor Tennenbaum Capital Partners LLC bought the operating assets of the foam cup and container maker in a court-approved sale in November.   Terms of the sale entitled Tennenbaum to take over various leases and other contracts, if it chose.   Lawyers for the company indicated in court documents Tennenbaum doesn't want the Radnor, Pa. headquarters; a $333,000-a-year warehouse in Fort Worth, Texas; or employment pacts with top executives, including Kennedy.   The bankruptcy code allows companies in Chapter 11 to cancel leases and other contracts before they have run their full term, capping the damages due.   Except for Tennenbaum, a secured creditor, most of Radnor Holdings' creditors are looking at slim chances of payment.   The sale proceeds of $211.4 million covered about $110 million in senior debt that Tennenbaum in essence paid back to itself, as well as debtor-in-possession financing.   At the hearing on the sale, Tennenbaum said it would pick up about $5 million in trade debt and $19 million worth of mortgage and equipment deals.   Kennedy founded the company in the early 1990s, and for years collected an annual salary that topped $3 million, according to court papers.   In 2004, Radnor Holdings was on the brink of launching itself into the public stock market by way of an initial public offering. Debt tied to expansion scuttled the IPO plan and sent Radnor on a hunt for new backers.   Tennenbaum invested $120 million in the company less than a year before its Aug. 21, 2006, bankruptcy filing. The private equity fund has renamed the operation it acquired "Wincup."   -By Peg Brickley, Dow Jones Newswires; 302-521-2266; peg.brickley@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 14:27 ET (19:27 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Boston Scientific:Intrinsic RV Meets Primary Endpoint>BSX
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   Boston Scientific Corp. (BSX) said a study of implantable cardioverter defibrillators met its primary endpoint, showing that dual-chamber pacing in combination with the company's AV Search Hysteresis programming performs as well as single-chamber pacing in reducing heart failure hospitalization and all cause mortality.   The Natick, Mass., medical products company said the study, called Intrinsic RV, is its largest to date.   Prior studies had suggested that dual-chamber devices may pose safety concerns, but the Intrinsic RV study showed 33% fewer deaths and heart-failure hospitalizations than single-chamber devices, Boston Scientific said.   The study was a multi-center trial that enrolled 1,530 patients with a current indication for an ICD at 108 centers in the U.S., Germany, Italy and Australia.   -Andrew Edwards; 201-938-5400; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 14:51 ET (19:51 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: IN THE PIPELINE: Mobile Security Concerns Spark New Mkt
Story: By Ellen Sheng     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--More business is being conducted away from the office these days than ever before, whether over cellphones or messages tapped on BlackBerries. And that worries a lot of businesses.   Concerns about the safety of sensitive data stored on these devices is also spawning a new security market. Smartphones - high-end phones that combine the functions of a PDA and computer - can now store copious amounts of data. Several high-profile laptop computer losses this year fanned fears about the risk posed by smartphones and other small devices with lots of memory. Boeing Co. (BA) reported in November that it lost a laptop crammed with the personal data of hundreds of thousands of employees. This was the company's third such breach in 13 months.   It's easy to imagine the problem getting more serious as smartphones get more popular.   "As devices get smaller and have more storage, the likelihood that information can leak out has gone through the roof," said Bob Egner, vice president of product management and global marketing at encryption technology firm Pointsec.   Companies are recognizing the threat. Security consultants say companies are still trying to figure out how to secure content on mobile devices. Some of the steps seem like common sense: limiting remote access to internal files, adding password protection, limiting online access. Companies are also adding encryption to secure their data and installing technology that can track or prevent documents from getting sent by email or instant messenger.   Vendors like Credant, Symantec Corp. (SYMC) or Finnish-based F-Secure OYJ (FSC1V.HE) are eager to cater to the growing need to protect mobile devices, especially as prices in the PC security market have come down. The total mobile phone security market is expected to grow to $5 billion in 2011, up from the current $750 million, according to Juniper Research, a U.K. market research firm.   The interest in security is coming from the growing number of smartphones. Smartphone use in the U.S. is lagging Europe and Asia, but the number of such devices is clearly growing. According to Telephia, a San Francisco market research firm, there were just under 6 million smartphones in the U.S. at the end of the third quarter, up from a little over 4 million six months earlier. Of those, a little more than half are being purchased by businesses, the firm estimates. Other calculations on the smartphone market have yielded far larger numbers, but Telephia has a narrower definition for smartphones.   Many corporate employees are now accessing the same files on handhelds they use on PCs. Unlike in Europe and Asia where mobile security concerns generally come from consumers, who are accustomed to using their phones for more than talking, interest in the U.S. is mainly from companies.       Forgetful Employees     Despite the publicity around viruses, hacker programs and phishing scams on mobile phones, the biggest security threat to companies is not from external breaches but from forgetful employees.   "The phone left in a taxi is the most common security issue these days," said Scott Horn, general manager at Microsoft Corp. (MSFT).   Interest in encryption has jumped as companies figure out what to do when forgetful employees leave devices behind. Encryption firms Credant and Pointsec have seen demand pick up dramatically this year.   Credant, Addison, Texas, encrypts data that is sitting on laptops, smartphones and other mobile devices and helps companies set up rules about how users can transfer files. Users also might be directed to enter a password or show a fingerprint.   In the coming year, the firms expect that protecting data stored on SD cards, USB sticks and memory cards will become more of a priority. To this end, Credant is developing products that will allow users to move encrypted data between devices more easily.   Pointsec, Lisle, Ill., similarly helped companies protect sensitive data with encryption. But while the threat has often been seen from the outside, the company is starting to guard against unscrupulous insiders as well. Egner says the company is preparing to launch a product later in the month that will help curb unauthorized file-sharing.   Attacking security with a different approach, Discretix, a San Mateo, Calif. technology firm, developed hardwarethat goes onto chip sets and encrypts data. Because it's not software, it's faster and harder to hack into, says Jacob Greenblatt, Discretix's director of strategy. The technology helps prevent data from falling into the wrong hands. While it doesn't combat viruses or Trojan horses, it can prevent an infection from spreading to sensitive parts of a smartphone. Discretix's Cryptocell technology will be included on three different Sony-Ericsson phones. Most Samsung GSM phones will also include the technology, Greenblatt said.   Microsoft has come out with a security package for Windows Mobile 5.0 that will allow users to manage security on their mobile devices in a similar fashion as on PCs. For example, the security pack will allow companies to set up passwords, limiting network access. Also, like with Credant or Pointsec, administrators will be able to wipe out data remotely or block access if a mobile device is lost or stolen. The software giant also announced that a new version of Exchange will include some new rights management functions for email, which can help prevent data from falling into the wrong hands.   For existing security giants, such as Symantec and McAfee Inc. (MFE), the focus on corporate security on mobile devices has been a boon.   In addition to threats of corporate espionage, companies are looking to ward off emerging viruses, just as on computers. Some emerging threats are snoopware, which is similar to spyware but can compromise some features on a cellphone such as the microphone or camera - enabling hackers to spy on their victims, said Khoi Nguyen, group product manager of mobile security at Symantec.   The emergence of smaller, portable devices has brought both benefits and headaches. And though the security industry is coming up with solutions, some of the best prescriptives are still common sense, according to industry-watchers: don't lose a smartphone or leave it out for someone to steal, don't open attachments from strangers and don't download a lot of applications.   -By Ellen Sheng, Dow Jones Newswires; 201-938-5863; ellen.sheng@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 11:00 ET (16:00 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Biomira: Merck KGaA To Enroll Patients For Stimuvax Trial
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   Biomira Inc. (BIOM) said Merck KGaA's (MRK.XE) Phase III trial of Stimuvax as a potential treatment for patients with unresectable stage III non-small cell lung cancer is now open for patient enrollment.   As a result, the Edmonton-based biotechnology company said it is entitled to a milestone payment upon the enrollment of the first patient, which is expected to occur later this month.   Stimuvax is a cancer vaccine designed to induce an immune response to cancer cells that express MUCI, a protein antigen expressed in common cancers.   The trial, which will be conducted by Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany, will include more than 1,300 patients in more than 30 countries.   -Adam Kuczynski; 201-938-5400; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 12:00 ET (17:00 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Scania Strengthens Its Hold on the Russian Bus Market
Story: STOCKHOLM, Sweden--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 02, 2007--   Scania's (STO:SCVA)(STO:SCVB) success in the Russian bus and coach market is continuing. During 2006, orderintake rose by 60 percent compared to last year and will reach about 400 units, which is the highest figure ever. Today Scania is the dominant manufacturer among western European bus makes in Russia.     "We have been successful because we have products that are well-adapted to Russian customers' demands for reliable, fuel-efficient buses," says Hans Hansson, Senior Vice President Buses and Coaches. "They also appreciate our strong service network and regional parts distribution centre, which contributes to the high uptime of customers' vehicles."     Most sales during the year were made together with domestic bus bodybuilding companies with which Scania has established collaboration.     But more than 40 percent of sales consisted of urban and intercity buses from Scania's own Omni range, which are made at the Scania Omni assembly plant in St. Petersburg, Russia.     Since the plant opened in 2002, Scania has produced about 800 buses there, of which more than 700 were destined for the Russian market. The others have been exported, mainly to Sweden.     All buses now being delivered from St Petersburg are equipped with Scania's 9-litre Euro 4 engines with exhaust-gas recirculation (EGR) technology, which efficiently safeguards environmental performance and operating economy.     "Many of our customers are private bus companies in regions around St Petersburg and Moscow, but also in other cities, which are investing in replacing their fleets of older buses with more cost-effective, environmentally optimised vehicles," says Alexander Sergeev, Sales Director at Scania Russia.     Scania is one of the world's leading manufacturers of trucks and buses for heavy transport applications, and of industrial and marine engines. A growing proportion of the company's operations consists of products and services in the financial and service sectors, assuring Scania customers of cost-effective transport solutions and maximum uptime. Employing 32,000 people, Scania operates in about 100 countries. Research and development activities are concentrated in Sweden, while production plants are located in Europe and South America, with facilities for the global exchange of both components and finished vehicles. In 2005, revenue totalled SEK 63.3 billion and net income amounted to SEK 4.7 billion.     Scania's press releases are available on the Internet at www.scania.com.     This information was brought to you by Waymaker http://www.waymaker.net        CONTACT: Scania               Gunnar Boman, mobile +46 70 550 86 06               Corporate Relations        SOURCE: Scania  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 04:09 ET (09:09 GMT)

Headline: : CHIP REIT Announces January Distribution>HOT.UN.T
Story: VANCOUVER, Jan. 2 /CNW/ - Canadian Hotel Income Properties Real Estate Investment Trust ("CHIP REIT") today announced a distribution of $0.0783 per unit for the month of January 2007. Payment will be made on January 31, 2007 to unitholders of record as at January 15, 2007.    CHIP REIT is an integrated hotel real estate investment trust focused on mid-market and upscale full-service hotels. Through its large, diversified portfolio, CHIP REIT provides investors with stable income and growth potential through acquisitions, repositioning and franchising under banners that include Delta, Radisson, Marriott and Hilton. CHIP REIT currently owns and manages 32 hotels with approximately 7,700 guestrooms. In 2006, CHIP REIT was named "Hotel Company of the Year" by Hotelier Magazine, becoming the first REIT to win a Pinnacle Award in the hospitality industry's national recognition program. Headline: CANADA TIP SHEET: Marquest Mgrs Avoid Dogmatism
Story: By Ben Dummett       Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     TORONTO (Dow Jones)--The managers of the C$3 million Marquest Resource fund can't be accused of being dogmatic.   Gerry Brockelsby and Andrew Cook say that, after a 20-year period of price declines, they believe commodity prices are in the early stages of a long-term uptrend on the back of strong economic growth in China and other emerging economies.   It was on this premise that the Marquest Resource fund was started about three years ago. However, the fund is broadly focused, allowing the managers to rotate in and out of different groups, recognizing that the relevant price performances of different commodities will fluctuate despite the general overall uptrend in resource prices.   For instance, the fund managers have been largely out of oil and gas stocks for the last year, preferring producers of other commodities such as uranium and zinc, Brockelsby said. The fund owns only one oil and gas stock, Pacific Stratus Energy Ltd. (PSE.V), an oil and gas company operating in Colombia.   For the one-year period ending Nov. 30, the fund is up 61%, sharply outpacing the average gain of 21% for the comparable group and a 20% rise in the relevant index, according to Globefund. On a three-year basis, the fund is up 22% versus 28% for the group average and a similar rise for the comparable index.   "There is still an economic cycle within this longer-term (rising) trend (in commodity prices), and within that cycle there is more demand for different commodities at certain points in the cycle," Cook said.   Take oil, for example. Since the price of oil "ran farthest first" reaching a price in the high US$70 a barrel range, consumers started to reduce their demand for crude, resulting in the subsequent slide in the price. That said, demand for crude remains relatively strong, given that the price remains around US$60 a barrel, Cook noted.       Bullish On Uranium     Indeed, Cook cites these still relatively higher prices for crude as a reason for the mangers' bullish view of uranium - an alternative source of energy.   The fund's uranium holdings include Paladin Resources Ltd. (PDN.AU) and SXR Uranium One Inc. (SXR.T). Both companies also highlight the managers' focus on mid-sized companies and some small-capitalized firms with either growing production bases or those just about to go into production. Often, these types of companies offer better value and have the potential for an upward valuation re-rating, the managers said.   For example, early next year Paladin is expected to start production at its mine in Namibia. In addition, Paladin and SXR could be takeover targets either for a bigger company or private-equity firms, the managers suggested.   In the base-metal group, the fund managers are particularly bullish on zinc and nickel producers. The supply-demand situation is tighter for these metals than for copper at the moment, as the price of the latter typically does better earlier in the cycle, the fund managers.   The fund's zinc-based holdings include Breakwater Resources Ltd. (BWLRF) and Hudbay Minerals Inc. (HBM.T). The fund also holds Rio Narcea Gold Mines Ltd. (RNO), a gold and nickel producer, and Skye Resources Inc. (SKR.T), a nickel producer.   Copper producer First Quantum Minerals Ltd (FM.T) is a stock the managers recently sold, reflecting a build-up in copper inventories and concerns over the margins of miners of this metal, the manager said.   -Ben Dummett, Dow Jones Newswires; 416-306-2024; ben.dummett@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 12:00 ET (17:00 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: UPDATE: Artemis Weighs Options On Possible Suez Bid
Story: (This updates an item that ran at 0835 GMT with comments from an analyst, Suez, GdF and the French market regulator.)       By Anne-Sylvaine Chassany     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     PARIS (Dow Jones)--French investment holding company Artemis SA, controlled by billionaire businessman Francois Pinault, said Tuesday that it is keeping all its options open over a possible bid for French-Belgian energy and water group Suez (SZE), sending Suez shares to new highs.   "After the request of (French market regulator) AMF, Artemis confirms that at this stage, no decision has been made regarding a possible bid for Suez shares and that all options remain open," Artemis said.   The statement comes after several weeks of speculation over an imminent Artemis bid for Suez, which is struggling to make its own planned merger with French state-owned gas company Gaz de France SA (1020848.FR) materialize.   In his statement Tuesday, "Pinault is indicating he doesn't rule out anything," Fideuram Wargny analyst Julien Picard said. "But I don't see anything happening before the French presidential election in the spring, as energy is a highly sensitive, political subject."   According to French market regulation, any entity that declares it doesn't intend to launch a bid for a listed company is then prevented from actually launching a bid for the following six months, "unless there are important changes" in the environment, the situation or the shareholding of the interested parties.   "We're currently studying the terms of the (Artemis) statement in light of our regulation," a spokeswoman for AMF said.   At 1005 GMT, Suez shares were up 1.5% at EUR39.8, implying a market value of EUR49.9 billion for the company.   Suez shares have surged in the past several weeks after a court postponed the GdF merger until after the French presidential election, making it more  unlikely as time passes and raising the chances of alternative bids for Suez.   The French socialist opposition party, which has opposed the privatization of GdF - a prerequisite for the merger with Suez - has said it would block the merger if it wins the election.   Several reports in the French press citing unnamed sources have indicated Pinault's interest in bidding for the whole of Suez, with the plan to sell the energy division back to GdF and to keep the water and waste business.   "Suez is an integrated industrial group. There are no assets for sale," a spokesman for Suez said Tuesday.   A GdF spokeswoman reminded that GdF's chairman and chief executive, Jean-Francois Cirelli, last week told French magazine Paris Match that GdF and Pinault did "not have any project in common" and that "the ideal solution" for GdF remained a merger with Suez.   At 1005 GMT. GdF shares were up 0.5% at EUR35.   -By Anne-Sylvaine Chassany, Dow Jones Newswires; +331 4017 1740; anne-sylvaine.chassany@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 05:46 ET (10:46 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : RPM Declares Quarterly Dividend
Story: MEDINA, Ohio, Jan. 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- RPM International Inc. (NYSE: RPM) today announced that its board of directors has declared a regular quarterly cash dividend of $0.175 per share, payable on January 31, 2007, to stockholders of record as of January 12, 2007. This payment represents a 9.4% increase over the quarterly cash dividend paid at this time last year.     RPM's latest cash dividend increase in October 2006 marked its 33rd consecutive year of increased cash dividends paid to its stockholders, which places RPM in an elite category of less than half of one percent of all 19,000 publicly-traded U.S. companies.  Only 79 other companies, besides RPM, have consecutively paid an increasing annual dividend for this period of time or longer, according to the 2007 edition of America's Finest Companies.  At a share price of $20.00, RPM's dividend yield would be 3.5%.     RPM International Inc., a holding company, owns subsidiaries that are world leaders in specialty coatings and sealants serving both industrial and consumer markets. RPM's industrial products include roofing systems, sealants, corrosion control coatings, flooring coatings and specialty chemicals. Industrial brands include Stonhard, Tremco, illbruck, Carboline, Day-Glo, Euco and Dryvit. RPM's consumer products are used by professionals and do-it- yourselfers for home maintenance and improvement, automotive and boat repair and maintenance, and by hobbyists. Consumer brands include Zinsser, Rust- Oleum, DAP, Varathane, Bondo and Testors.     For more information, contact Glenn R. Hasman, vice president - finance and communications, at 330-273-8820 or ghasman@rpminc.com.    SOURCE  RPM International Inc.       /CONTACT: Glenn R. Hasman, vice president - finance and communications of RPM International Inc., +1-330-273-8820, or ghasman@rpminc.com      /Web site: http://www.rpminc.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 08:00 ET (13:00 GMT)

Headline: : National Instruments Invites You to Join Us for Our Fourth Quarter 2006 Earnings Conference Call
Story: AUSTIN, Texas--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 02, 2007--   National Instruments (NASDAQ: NATI) will release results for the fourth quarter of 2006 after the stock market closes on January 30, 2007. The release will be followed by an investor conference call, during which management will discuss the company's performance in the fourth quarter. About National Instruments     For 30 years, National Instruments (www.ni.com) has been a technology pioneer and leader in virtual instrumentation - a revolutionary concept that has changed the way engineers and scientists in industry, government and academia approach measurement and automation. Leveraging PCs and commercial technologies, virtual instrumentation increases productivity and lowers costs for test, control and design applications through easy-to-integrate software, such as NI LabVIEW, and modular measurement and control hardware for PXI, PXI Express, PCI, PCI Express, USB and Ethernet. Headline: Toronto Stocks Higher At Midday: Positive Start To Year
Story: By Monica Gutschi       OF DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     TORONTO (Dow Jones)--The stock market was higher at midday Tuesday, starting 2007 on a positive note. Gold miners led the market as the price of gold gained on a weaker U.S. dollar.   However, activity was muted as U.S. markets were closed for the funeral of former President Gerald Ford.   At 11:45 a.m. EST (1645 GMT), the S&P/TSX Composite Index was up 72.10 points, or 0.56%, at 12980.49. Advancers led decliners 592 to 544. Trading volume was a slim 62.4 million shares.   The S&P/TSX 60 Index was up 5.3 points, or 0.71%, to 748.1 points.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 11:50 ET (16:50 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : XpressBet(R) again offers $130,000 in online tournaments
Story: AURORA, ON, Jan. 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ - Magna Entertainment Corp. ("MEC") (NASDAQ: MECA; TSX: MEC.A) today announced that for the second consecutive year XpressBet, Inc. ("XpressBet"), MEC's Advance Deposit Wagering Service, will offer account holders a series of lucrative online handicapping tournaments involving races from Gulfstream Park and Santa Anita Park with cash and qualifying prizes totaling over $130,000.     "Horseplayers love to compete," said Ron Luniewski, President of XpressBet. "The convenience of playing online for attractive prizes is compelling and the tiered structure of our events offers players at any level a shot at the top prize."     In XpressBet's tournament series, all roads lead to the $50,000 XpressBet Showdown(TM) on March 24 and 25, 2007. The event has a $20,000 winner's share and the top two finishers earn berths in the '08 Coast Casinos Horse Player World Series in Las Vegas. Players can qualify for the $50,000 XpressBet Showdown in two preliminary tournaments--$50,000 XpressBet Beat the HostTM and $30,000 XpressBet Live(TM)--or they can buy into the main event by paying a $500 registration fee.     Starting off the tournaments is the $50,000 XpressBet Beat the Host, offered Saturdays in January and February, which has no registration fee and matches XpressBet account holders against HRTV hosts Jon White or Jeff Siegel in eight mandatory races. Each week, the top five finishers earn a share of $2,500 in cash prizes. Additionally, players who `beat the host' in weekly competitions automatically qualify for the $5,000 XpressBet Beat the Host Championship on March 3, 2007. The top 40 finishers in the Championship advance to the $50,000 XpressBet Showdown--a $500 value each. There's also a $5,000 XpressBet Sweep the Host(TM) bonus available to any player who `beats the host' in all eight weeks of competition.     The next tournament, $30,000 XpressBet Live, has a $50 registration fee and is a two-day online competition March 17 and 18, 2007, for cash prizes including a $5,000 winner's share. Plus, the top 40 finishers in this event also qualify for the $50,000 XpressBet Showdown--a $500 value each.     Last year, XpressBet account holder Jack Demita took down the $40,000 top prize in the XpressBet Showdown and Stephen Speros, who qualified for the main event via XpressBet Beat the Host, collected $20,000 for finishing second.     "The Xpressbet tournament was great, a real good deal and definitely worth it," beamed Speros. "I'll positively be back again."     Demita and Speros will represent XpressBet in Coast Casinos Horse Player World Series January 18-20, 2007 in Las Vegas.     To register, or for more information on XpressBet's online handicapping tournaments visit www.xpressbet.com.        About Magna Entertainment Corp.     MEC is North America's largest owner and operator of horse racetracks, based on revenue. It develops, owns and operates horse racetracks and related pari-mutuel wagering operations, including off-track betting facilities. In 2005, MEC created PariMax Inc., a subsidiary that oversees its various electronic distribution platforms, including XpressBet(R), a national Internet and telephone account wagering system, and Horse Racing TV(R), a 24-hour horse racing television network, as well as MagnaBet(R) internationally. In March 2006, MEC partnered with Churchill Downs, Inc. ("CDI") and Racing UK to launch Racing World, which broadcasts race content provided by MEC and CDI into the United Kingdom and Ireland, and allows those residents to wager on North American content. MEC trades on the NASDAQ National Market under the symbol MECA and on the TSX under the symbol MEC.A. MEC can be found on the Internet at www.magnaentertainment.com.        About XpressBet, Inc.     XpressBet is a legal, licensed, U.S.-based account wagering provider that offers pari-mutuel wagering on thoroughbred, harness and quarter horse racing events either online or by telephone. The service was launched by Magna Entertainment Corp. in 2002 and is headquartered in Washington, PA. XpressBet is regulated and licensed in several states. XpressBet uses the latest in advanced technology to present state-of-the-art speed, security, and efficiency to account holders. The service offers over 100 tracks online including online audio and video of selected tracks. XpressBet can be found on the internet at www.xpressbet.com. Headline: Banco Sabadell Mandates Bks For Euro 10Y Benchmark Bond
Story: LONDON (Dow Jones)--Banco Sabadell (SAB.MC) has mandated Barclays Capital, Citigroup and UBS Investment Bank as joint lead managers of its forthcoming covered bond issue, one of the lead managers said Tuesday.   The bonds will be denominated in euros and will carry a 10-year maturity, the lead said.   The deal will launch and price the week of Jan. 8, subject to market conditions.   The bonds have been awarded an expected triple-A credit rating from Moody's Investors Service Inc.     -By Saadia Hashmy, Dow Jones Newswires; 44 20 7842 9482; saadia.hashmy@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 09:11 ET (14:11 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Ascendia Brands, Inc. Restructures $91 Million Convertible Note from Prencen Lending
Story: HAMILTON, N.J.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 02, 2007--   Ascendia Brands, Inc., (AMEX: ASB) announced that it has restructured the $91 million convertible note from Prencen Lending LLC ("Prencen"), an affiliate of Prentice Capital Management. Pursuant to the terms of the restructuring, the $91 million convertible note was amended and restated and will now mature in December 2016.     The terms of the amended and restated note include a reduction in the conversion price from $1.75 to $0.42, the right of Ascendia or Prencen to cause the redemption of the convertible note at a 7 percent premium at any time from and after the 8 year anniversary of the amended and restated convertible note, and Prencen's agreement to exchange up to $40 million of principal amount of the convertible note into preferred stock, for a 15 percent exchange fee, if required to maintain Ascendia's shareholders' equity at a level consistent with American Stock Exchange listing requirements. As partial consideration for the restructuring, Prencen waived existing events of default under the convertible note, waived compliance with certain financial covenants through the end of Ascendia's current fiscal year, extended certain deadlines for the filing of a registration statement with respect to the conversion shares and extended the period during which interest on the convertible note accrues.     The amended and restated note also allows Ascendia to redeem up to $20 million of the principal amount of the convertible note (up to $10 million at a 15% premium and an additional $10 million at a premium to be agreed upon) in connection with the consummation of that certain acquisition for which Ascendia has previously announced that it has obtained clearance under the Hart-Scott-Rodino Antitrust Improvements Act of 1976. Negotiations concerning such acquisition and related acquisition financing are actively progressing, though no definitive agreements have been signed and there is no assurance that the transaction will be consummated.       About Ascendia Brands     Ascendia Brands, Inc. is a leader in the value and premium value segments of the health and beauty care products sector. In November 2005, Ascendia expanded its range of product offerings through the acquisition of a series of brands, including Baby Magic(R), Binaca(R), Mr. Bubble(R) and Ogilvie(R). The company is headquartered in Hamilton, New Jersey, and operates two manufacturing facilities, in Binghamton, New York, and Toronto, Canada. Visit http://www.ascendiabrands.com for additional information.     Certain statements contained herein may constitute forward-looking statements within the meaning of Section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933, 21E of the Exchange Act of 1934 and/or the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Such statements include, without limitation, statements regarding business plans, future regulatory environment and approval and, the Company's ability to comply with the rules and policies of independent regulatory agencies. Although the Company believes the statements contained herein to be accurate as of the date they were made, it can give no assurance that such expectations will prove to be correct. The Company undertakes no obligation to update these forward-looking statements.        CONTACT: Ascendia Brands, Inc. Headline: Mexico Stocks Carry Momentum Into 2007; IPC Index +0.6%
Story: MEXICO CITY (Dow Jones)--Mexican stocks carried last year's rally into the new year, with local equities gaining early Tuesday in light holiday trading.   Around 10:35 a.m. EST, the market's IPC index was up 0.6% at 26,609.57. Volume was 3.2 million shares, valued at 98.2 million pesos ($9.1 million).   Meanwhile, U.S. markets were closed to observe a day of mourning for former President Gerald Ford.   The IPC rose 48.6% last year, the fourth straight year of gains for the index, which rose 37.8% in 2005, 46.9% in 2004, and 43.5% in 2003.   The index weathered a correction in May and June before roaring back to life in the second half of the year, thanks to strong corporate earnings and a more positive economic outlook for the U.S.   Analysts remain positive about the outlook for the IPC in 2007, but much will depend on the U.S. economy, which absorbs about 85% of Mexico's exports.   In local markets, the L shares of mobile operator America Movil (AMX) were gaining 0.2% at MXN24.43, and shares of fixed-line operator Telefonos de Mexico (TMX) were up 0.2% at MXN15.35.   Meanwhile, the V shares of Mexico's top retailer Wal-Mart de Mexico (WALMEX.MX) were rising 1.6% to MXN48.30, and the O shares of banking group Banorte (GFNORTE.MX) were up 1% at MXN42.69.   The UBD shares of Femsa (FMX) were down 0.1% at MXN125.00 in early trading after the brewing and bottling company said it will raise beer prices in line with this year's expected inflation.     By Ken Parks, Dow Jones Newswires, 52-55-5080-3453, ken.parks@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 10:42 ET (15:42 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Advanced Medical Optics to Present at Two Investor Conferences in January 2007
Story: Advanced Medical Optics to Present at Two Investor Conferences in January 2007          SANTA ANA, Calif., Jan. 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Advanced Medical  Optics, Inc. (AMO) (NYSE: EYE), today announced that Corporate Vice President,  Research and Development Leonard Borrmann, will present an overview of the  company and an update of R&D activities at the Morgan Stanley Pharmaceutical  CEOs Unplugged Conference in New York City on Thursday, January 4 at 8:45am ET.          (Logo: http://www.newscom.com/cgi-bin/prnh/20050324/AMOLOGO)        AMO Chairman, President and CEO Jim Mazzo is also scheduled to provide a  corporate overview at the 25th Annual JP Morgan Healthcare Conference in San  Francisco on Thursday, January 11 at 6:30am ET.        To access an audio webcast of these presentations, please visit AMO's  Investors site at http://www.amo-inc.com.          About Advanced Medical Optics (AMO)        AMO is a global medical device leader focused on the discovery and  delivery of innovative vision technologies that optimize the quality of life  for people of all ages.  Products in the ophthalmic surgical line include  intraocular lenses, laser vision correction systems, phacoemulsification  systems, viscoelastics, microkeratomes and related products used in cataract  and refractive surgery.  AMO owns or has the rights to such ophthalmic  surgical product brands as ReZoom(TM), Clariflex(R), Sensar(R), CeeOn(R),  Tecnis(R) and Verisyse(TM) intraocular lenses, STAR S4 IR(TM) laser vision  correction system, WaveScan Wavefront(R) System, CustomVue(TM) procedure,  Sovereign(R) and Sovereign(R) Compact(TM) phacoemulsification systems with  WhiteStar(R) technology, Amadeus(TM) and Amadeus(TM) II microkeratomes,  Healon(R) viscoelastics, and the Baerveldt(R) glaucoma shunt.  Products in the  contact lens care line include disinfecting solutions, enzymatic cleaners and  lens rewetting drops.  Among the eye care product brands the company possesses  are COMPLETE(R) Moisture PLUS(TM), COMPLETE(R) Blink-N-Clean(R), Consept(R)F,  Consept(R) 1 Step, Oxysept(R) 1 Step, UltraCare(R), Ultrazyme(R), Total  Care(TM) and blink(TM) branded products.  Amadeus is a licensed product of,  and a trademark of, SIS, Ltd.  AMO is based in Santa Ana, California, and  employs approximately 3,800 worldwide.  The company has operations in  24 countries and markets products in approximately 60 countries.  For more  information, visit the company's Web site at www.amo-inc.com. Headline: Suez Calls On AMF To Ask Pinault To Clarify Intentions
Story: PARIS (Dow Jones)--Franco-Belgian utility group Suez (SZE) Tuesday said it has requested that French market regulator AMF ask the group controlled by billionaire Francois Pinault to further clarify its intentions as regards a possible bid for the company.   Earlier Tuesday, Artemis SA, the investment holding for the Pinault Group, said it was keeping all its options open on possibly making a bid for Suez.   "Suez considers that the Pinault Group's vague and imprecise statement gives no clear indication of its real intentions, and does not give information in a satisfactory manner to the financial markets," Suez said in a statement.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 08:24 ET (13:24 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Citi Prefers Ericsson To Alcatel-Lucent, Nokia Before 4Q
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   Citigroup on Tuesday said it prefers Telefon AB L.M. Ericsson (ERIC) to Alcatel-Lucent (ALU) and Nokia Corp. (NOK) ahead of the European telecom equipment makers' fourth-quarter statements.   On Ericsson, Citigroup sees little risk to consensus EPS numbers with quarter-on-quarter revenue growth better than normal seasonality and continuing margin improvement driven by Marconi restructuring, operational leverage and Sony Ericsson mobile phone venture.   On Alcatel, Citigroup says it is hard to assess the risk to consensus due to the closure of the Lucent deal so late in the quarter, but the focal issue is likely to be commentary on the synergy outlook, where Citi sees upside risk to stated targets.   On Nokia, Citigroup sees a "substantial" risk of a repeat of the third-quarter results, with strong unit sales growth but weak average selling prices and margin driven by strength in China and India and weakness in Western Europe and North America.   -Steve Goldstein; 415-439-6400; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 04:39 ET (09:39 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : A.M. Best Upgrades Issuer Credit and Debt Ratings for the Members of The Navigators Group, Inc.
Story: OLDWICK, N.J.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 02, 2007--   A.M. Best Co. has affirmed the financial strength rating of A (Excellent) and upgraded the issuer credit ratings (ICR) to "a+" from "a" for Navigators Insurance Group (Navigators), which is comprised of Navigators Insurance Company and its wholly-owned subsidiary, NIC Insurance Company. A.M. Best has also upgraded the ICR to "bbb+" from "bbb" for The Navigators Group, Inc. (Navigators) (NASDAQ: NAVG). Concurrently, A.M. Best has upgraded the debt ratings to "bbb+" from "bbb" on Navigators' $125 million of 7% senior unsecured notes, due 2016; to "bbb-" from "bb+" on preferred securities; to "bbb" from "bbb-" on subordinated notes; and to "bbb+" from "bbb" on senior unsecured notes under the shelf registration. All companies are domiciled in New York, NY. The outlook for all ratings is stable.     The ratings recognize Navigators' leading position as a global provider of insurance to the marine energy sector, its solid level of capitalization, management's conservative approach to underwriting and claims management and its improving level of profitability.     These positive rating factors are somewhat offset by the group's rapid growth in relatively new lines of business in recent years and its somewhat elevated dependence on reinsurance. Nevertheless, the financial flexibility and explicit support of the holding company is sufficient to offset these concerns. The financial leverage of the parent organization is a conservative 19% of debt-to-total tangible capital, with coverage ratios far exceeding A.M. Best's requirements for the current rating levels. The rating outlook anticipates continued strong earnings performance and strong capitalization.     For Best's Debt Ratings, all other Best's Ratings, an overview of the rating process and rating methodologies, please visit www.ambest.com/ratings.     A.M. Best Co., established in 1899, is the world's oldest and most authoritative insurance rating and information source. For more information, visit A.M. Best's Web site at www.ambest.com. Headline: : Hilb Rogal & Hobbs Completes Acquisition of Loan Protector Insurance Services
Story: RICHMOND, Va.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 02, 2007--   Hilb Rogal & Hobbs Company (NYSE: HRH), the world's tenth largest insurance and risk management intermediary, announced that effective January 1, 2007, it has completed the previously announced acquisition of the operating assets of Cleveland-based Loan Protector General Agency, Inc. and Loan Protector Tracking Services, Inc. (collectively known as Loan Protector Insurance Services). Terms of the transaction were not disclosed.     Loan Protector Insurance Services, a leading provider of customized insurance tracking programs and lender-placed insurance products to the mortgage industry, expects revenues of approximately $8 million for 2006. Servicing a niche community of banks, savings and loan organizations, credit unions and mortgage companies, Loan Protector's President, Ronald F. Wiser, and his team will continue to work from their Cleveland office under their existing management. They will become part of HRH's Mid-Atlantic Region, led by HRH's Mid-Atlantic Regional Director Steven C. Deal.     HRH Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Martin L. (Mell) Vaughan, III, said, "HRH routinely explores opportunities to increase our product and service offerings and capabilities, as well as ways to gain exposure in new markets. Loan Protector provides specialized insurance products to financial institutions, a specific type of client base. We are excited to seek new business prospects within this market and look forward to incorporating Loan Protector's capabilities with our list of offerings. It is my pleasure to welcome Ron Wiser and his associates to the HRH family."     Hilb Rogal & Hobbs Company is the eighth largest insurance intermediary in the United States, with over 120 offices throughout the United States and London. HRH helps clients manage their risks in property and casualty, employee benefits, professional liability and other areas of specialized exposure. In addition, HRH offers a full range of personal and corporate financial products and services. HRH is focused on understanding our clients' businesses, employees and risks, as well as the insurance and financial markets, so that we can develop insurance, risk management and employee benefits solutions that best fit their needs. The company's common stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange, symbol HRH. More information about HRH may be found at www.hrh.com. Headline: 3rd UPDATE:Lennar See Housing Recovery Yet; Cuts JV Stake
Story: By Janet Morrissey     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--Lennar Corp. (LEN) Chief Executive Stuart Miller is seeing no signs that the deteriorating home-building market has bottomed, and Lennar expects to take land-related writedowns of between $400 million and $500 million in its fiscal fourth quarter to reflect the weak conditions.   "Market conditions continued to weaken throughout  the fourth quarter, and we have not yet seen tangible evidence of a market recovery," said Miller, in a statement.   At the same time, the company slashed its exposure to the troubled California market, where market conditions have been deteriorating at a fast clip. Lennar, along with its partner LNR Property Corp, agreed to sell a 62% stake in their LandSource joint venture, whose primary investment, Newhall Land and Farming, owns 15,000 acres of land in the Santa Clarita Valley of California. Lennar and LNR will each receive $660 million for the stake from the new partner, MW Housing. Lennar will continue to get management fees and retain a 19% stake in the partnership.   "I think it sends a signal that they don't want to have their capital at risk in Southern California for the next few years," said Raymond James analyst Rick Murray. He sees the sale as a sign that the company doesn't believe that a rebound in California will happen in the near future.   Murray adds that it is a win-win situation for Lennar.   "It looks, on the surface, to be a fantastic deal for Lennar," said Murray. "The company is effectively selling a 62% interest and recovering basically all of the capital that it originally put into the deal when it acquired Newhall." As a result, Lennar will continue to hold a 19% interest and collect management fees on the venture "and have no capital at risk," he said. Murray doesn't hold shares in Lennar, and his firm hasn't had an investment-banking relationship with the company in the past year.   Lennar, based in Miami, also offered its preliminary results for the fiscal fourth quarter, which ended Nov. 30.   The builder's orders fell 6% in the latest quarter, which is better than many of its rivals, who have been experiencing declines of 20% to 40%. However, the small order decline reflects aggressive price slashing and incentives, not improved demand.   Lennar has acknowledged from the start of the housing slowdown that it has resorted to price slashing and other incentives to move sales. It adopted this strategy early on based on its belief that selling homes and maintaining good liquidity was more important than keeping house prices up during the slowdown.   "While we are hopeful that low interest rates, strong employment and a healthy economy will help stimulate a recovery in 2007, we have continued to focus on strengthening our balance sheet by delivering our backlog, selling inventory aggressively and renegotiating our land positions," said Miller. "We ended the 2006 fiscal year with zero outstanding on our $2.7 billion revolving credit facility and over $600 million of cash on the balance sheet."   The price discounting and incentives took a toll on the company's gross profit margins, which were "materially lower" in the quarter, he said.   Lennar expects to report earnings in the range of 70 cents to 75 cents a share.  However, the company will take a charge in the range of $400 million to $500 million, in land-related writedowns. When this is factored in, the company will post a loss of between 88 cents and $1.28 a share. Thomson First Call currently lists the company's operating earnings, before charges, of $1.07, down 70% from a year earlier.   -By Janet Morrissey, Dow Jones Newswires; 201-938-2118     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 12:03 ET (17:03 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Mexico's Femsa To Raise Beer Prices In Line With Inflation
Story: MEXICO CITY (Dow Jones)--Mexican brewing and bottling firm Femsa (FMX) said it will raise beer prices in line with this year's expected inflation.   In a press release Monday, Monterrey-based Femsa said the increases will vary with different regions and presentations, although the average will be in line with inflation.   The company didn't specify what expected inflation rate it was using. The Bank of Mexico has a permanent inflation target of 3%, which is incorporated into the federal budget.   The Consumer Price Index is expected to rise 3.5% in 2007, however, according to the central bank's most recent survey of private economists. Inflation is expected to have ended 2006 around 4%.   Femsa said that aside from compensating for inflation, the price hikes are aimed at recovering higher costs of aluminum, glass bottles and barley that the company faced in 2006.   The increases will be implemented over a six-week period beginning Jan. 1.     -By Anthony Harrup, Dow Jones Newswires; (5255) 5080 3450; anthony.harrup@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 10:12 ET (15:12 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.
