Headline: INTERVIEW:Banco do Brasil CEO Sees '07 Loan Growth Up 30%
Story: By Rogerio Jelmayer     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     SAO PAULO (Dow Jones)--Brazil's state-run Banco do Brasil SA (BBAS3.BR), the country's largest financial institution, expects to see another huge boost in its credit portfolios in 2007, led by expansion of consumer credit, the bank's chief executive officer told Dow Jones Newswires in an interview Tuesday.   "I have great expectations for 2007," said Antonio Francisco de Lima Neto. "I expect total credit portfolios to expand by 30%."   The bank's credit portfolios totaled 118.3 billion Brazilian reals ($55.4 billion) at the end of the third quarter of 2006, an increase of 24.9% from the same period the previous year. According to Lima, the bank's credit portfolio had reached an estimated BRL128.5 billion by Nov. 30.   "We want to increase our presence when it comes to consumer credit linked directly to payroll deductions," said Lima. He added, "The bank could do this through partnerships or even the purchase of some specific portfolios."   However, Lima noted that the increase in Banco do Brasil's credit portfolio in 2006 came with some problematic side-effects. The bank posted third-quarter provisions against bad loans of BRL1.63 billion, up 40% from BRL1.17 billion a year previously.   As with other Brazilian banks, concern about arrears in consumer loans has risen with the expansion of loan portfolios to lower income customers.   The bank "will be on constant alert for any change in the level of arrears," Lima said.   The bank has tended to accumulate higher provisions compared with its peers in the industry because the biggest portion of its portfolio is farm loans, which suffered a crisis during 2006. Earlier in the year, the government permitted holders of farm loans to stretch out existing credits, easing some of the financial pressure on agricultural borrowers but reducing inflows for Banco do Brasil.   "I am expecting an improvement in our farm portfolio in 2007, due to an increase in prices for some farm commodities," said Lima.   The CEO of Brazil's biggest bank declined to provide any forecasts for the bank's 2007 earnings or revenue performance. However, he offered that the bank's strategy would emphasize "growth, profitability and a high degree of excellence in corporative governance."   Lima said, "Before I assumed the post (in December), I met with Finance Minister Guido Mantega and he sent me a clear message - growth, profitability and corporate governance are the pillars."   Lima, a career employee at Banco Brazil, took over the firm's helm in December, after the exit of Rossano Maranhao. President Luis Inacio Lula da Silva, who took office for a second term on Jan. 1, has yet to confirm any of his major cabinet or government entity appointments for the new administration.   Lima, meanwhile, also reinforced the bank's commitment to sell more shares to the market as a way of increasing its free float.   In June, the Banco do Brasil sold 52.26 million shares, raising BRL2.27 billion, while also migrating its shares to the investor-friendly Novo Mercado mechanism on the Sao Paulo Stock Exchanges, or Bovespa.   The Novo Mercado has the most rigorous rules for listing on the Bovespa. Participants' free float must reach 25% of shares and 100% of shares must be common, or voting, shares, rather than preferred shares.   After the 2006 operation, the free float of the bank rose to 12.5% from 7%. Banco do Brasil is controlled by the Brazilian Treasury, which holds a 72.1% stake, while the bank's own pension fund Previ holds 12% and the equity arm of the Brazilian Development Bank, BNDESPar, holds a 3.4% stake.   "I can't guarantee that we will sell sufficient shares in 2007 up to the point where we reach a 25% free float," said Lima. "However, selling more shares is certainly at the top of my agenda for the year."   A company joining the Novo Mercado has 36 months to increase its free float to 25% - setting a June 2009 deadline.   Banco do Brasil reported a third-quarter net profit of BRL907 million, down from BRL1.44 billion in the same quarter a year ago, attributed to an extraordinary tax gain in the year-ago quarter, which created an unusually high basis for comparison.   Banco do Brasil is Brazil's largest retail bank, managing total assets of BRL281.6 billion as of the end of the third quarter. The bank ended the quarter with a total of 24.1 million account holders.   As of 1445 GMT, the bank's shares were up 1.55% at BRL64.99, while the main stock index was up 1.27%.     -By Rogerio Jelmayer, Dow Jones Newswires; 5511-3145-1480; rogerio.jelmayer@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 12:10 ET (17:10 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Phillips-Van Heusen Corporation Announces Strategic Licensing Arrangement with Harbor Footwear Group, Ltd. for Bass Footwear
Story: NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 02, 2007--   Phillips-Van Heusen Corporation (NYSE: PVH) today announced it has entered into a licensing agreement with Harbor Footwear Group, Ltd. to market men's, women's and children's footwear for the Bass brand, including the iconic Weejun and Sunjun, throughout the world.     Under the agreement, the 130-year old Bass brand will continue to be sold in better department stores and independent retailers throughout the U.S., as well as through distributors in over 30 countries around the world. Harbor, which has licensed the rights to design, source and market Bass footwear worldwide on a wholesale basis, will assume the current Bass business in February 2007 and will launch its first collection at the June FFANY Show in New York. PVH will continue to operate its Bass outlet retail stores, which sell apparel and accessories, as well as footwear.     "We are thrilled to partner with Harbor Footwear, one of the leaders in the footwear industry," said Allen Sirkin, President and Chief Operating Officer of PVH. "We are confident that they share our vision for the future of the Bass brand and will build on its history as one of the most recognizable and successful brands of footwear."     Dennis S. Lazar, President and Chief Executive Officer of Harbor Footwear Group stated that "Harbor will capitalize on its strengths of product design and sourcing to offer footwear of exceptional quality and value to consumers under the Bass brand. We believe the combination of PVH's marketing strength and Harbor's product capabilities ensure a bright future for this great brand."     Phillips-Van Heusen Corporation is one of the largest clothing companies in the world. It owns and markets the Calvin Klein brand worldwide. It is the largest shirt company in the world and markets a variety of products under its own trademarks, Van Heusen, Calvin Klein, IZOD, Arrow, Bass, and G.H. Bass and Co., and its licensed trademarks, Geoffrey Beene, Kenneth Cole NY, Kenneth Cole Reaction, unlisted, A Kenneth Cole Production, BCBG Max Azria, BCBG Attitude, MICHAEL Michael Kors, Sean John, Chaps, Donald J. Trump Signature Collection, and JOE Joseph Abboud.     Harbor Footwear Group, Ltd. is one of the leading design, distribution and sourcing companies operating in the men's fashion footwear industry today. In business since 1969, Harbor Footwear is the owner of the Giorgio Brutini, GBX, Impulse and Zengara brands in footwear and, in addition, licenses its Giorgio Brutini marque for apparel and accessories. Headline: : Performance Food Group Announces Webcast to Review 2007 Forecast
Story: RICHMOND, Va.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 02, 2007--   Performance Food Group (Nasdaq/NGS: PFGC) announced today that it will provide an online, real-time webcast and rebroadcast of its conference call to review its forecast for the 2007 fiscal year.     The live broadcast of Performance Food Group's conference call to review the 2007 forecast will be available online at www.pfgc.com on Tuesday, January 9, 2007, beginning at 10 a.m. (Eastern Time). An online replay of the webcast will be available approximately one hour after the call. Any information disclosed on the conference call that has not been previously disclosed publicly will be available at www.pfgc.com. A press release announcing the Company's 2007 forecast will be issued prior to the conference call and will be available at www.pfgc.com.     Performance Food Group markets and distributes more than 66,000 national and private label food and food-related products to approximately 44,000 restaurants, hotels, cafeterias, schools, healthcare facilities and other institutions. For more information on Performance Food Group, visit www.pfgc.com.     Certain statements made herein are forward-looking statements under the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. These statements involve risks and uncertainties and are based on current expectations and management's estimates; actual results may differ materially. The risks and uncertainties which could impact these statements include, but are not limited to, general economic conditions, including consumer spending trends; the Company's ability to achieve projected operational efficiencies and increase sales, particularly higher margin street sales; the relatively low margins and economic sensitivity of the foodservice business; the Company's reliance on major customers; the ability to identify and successfully complete acquisitions of other foodservice distributors; the Company's ability to successfully develop, produce and market new products and management of the Company's planned growth, all as detailed from time to time in the reports filed by the Company with the Securities and Exchange Commission. Headline: : North Dallas Bank Promotes Seven
Story: DALLAS, Jan. 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- The board of directors of North Dallas Bank & Trust Co. (OTC Bulletin Board: NODB) announced today the following promotions: Julie Gates, Mary Martin, Janis McKay and Teri Nahoolewa to vice president, Donna Brule to banking officer, Albert Bustos to security officer and Brooke Dunham to trust officer.     Gates initially joined North Dallas Bank as a Collections Teller in November of 1985, taking on the responsibilities of processing drafts, collection items and issuing official checks.  In December 1995, she was appointed to banking officer and Loan Operations Manager before being appointed to assistant vice president in December 1997.  As vice president, Gates will continue to oversee the bank's loan operations area.     Martin, a 35-year employee of North Dallas Bank, began her banking career as a teller and was promoted to assistant vice president in July of 1979. Martin is responsible for managing the Dallas location's drive-in banking facility.     McKay, a 26-year industry professional, joined North Dallas Bank in July of 2000 as assistant vice president.  As vice president, she will continue to manage operations at the Las Colinas Banking Center.     With over 15-years of banking experience, Nahoolewa joined North Dallas Bank in August of 2004 as assistant vice president.  As vice president, she will continue to manage operations at the Addison Banking Center.     Brule, a 10-year employee of North Dallas Bank, began her career as a teller at the Las Colinas Banking Center.  In July 2003, she obtained her current position.  Brule will assist in managing the deposit operations area of the bank.  As a native of Somerset, Pennsylvania, she earned an undergraduate degree in mathematics and psychology from The University of Pittsburgh.     Bustos began his career in 1997 in the bank's mail distribution center. In March of 1999, he obtained his current position in cash management.  Along with his new responsibility of overseeing the bank's security efforts, he will continue to assist in day-to-day cash management activities.     A five-year employee of North Dallas Bank, Dunham will be responsible for personal trust accounts, IRAs, qualified plans and investment management. She has an undergraduate degree in speech communications from Baylor University. Married, she and her husband are expecting their first child in March of 2007.     Larry Nobles, vice chairman of North Dallas Bank & Trust Co., said after the announcements, "I am proud of these individuals. They all have made consistent contributions to North Dallas Bank and reflect the values outlined in our mission statement."     North Dallas Bank & Trust Co., established in 1961, has more than $924 million in assets and is a locally owned bank with five locations in the Dallas area.           Media Relations Contact       Michael Linck       Assistant Vice President       (972) 716-7121       michael.linck@ndbt.com      SOURCE  North Dallas Bank & Trust Co.       /CONTACT: Michael Linck, Assistant Vice President of North Dallas Bank & Trust Co., +1-972-716-7121, or michael.linck@ndbt.com      /Web site: http://www.ndbt.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 12:58 ET (17:58 GMT)

Headline: : Northrop Grumman to Support Joint Distribution Process Analysis Center for U.S. Transportation Command
Story: Northrop Grumman to Support Joint Distribution Process Analysis Center for U.S. Transportation Command   MCLEAN, Va., Jan. 2, 2007 (PRIME NEWSWIRE) -- Northrop Grumman Corporation (NYSE:NOC) has been selected by the U.S. Transportation Command to help establish a Joint Distribution Process Analysis Center that will integrate analytic capabilities across the organization and support joint operations.   Under the terms of the contract, Northrop Grumman's Information Technology (IT) sector will perform distribution performance analysis; design and implementation of a knowledge management capability; organizational design; supply chain risk and threat analysis; skills alignment and a training plan; and governance structure support.   "As a full-service IT provider, Northrop Grumman has demonstrated that gains in efficiency can be achieved with solutions such as supply chain management," said Dr. Jim Barry, vice president of technology integration and applications for Northrop Grumman IT. "Our work and expertise on this contract will allow the U.S. Transportation Command to perform key functions and processes more quickly and effectively."   The mission of the Joint Distribution Process Analysis Center is to support joint operations among the U.S. Transportation Command, the Military Surface Deployment and Distribution Command, the Air Mobility Command, and the Military Surface Deployment and Distribution Command's Transportation Engineering Agency. The center will advance operations, programmatic study support and transformation and leverage analytic expertise from Joint Deployment and Distribution Enterprise partners.   The contract is valued at $8.8 million over one year with two one-year options. The majority of the work on the contract will be conducted at Scott Air Force Base, Ill.   Northrop Grumman's teammates on the contract include Logistics Management Institute Government Contracting, McLean, Va.; Pittiglio, Rabin, Todd, McGrath, Washington, D.C.; Stanley Associates, Arlington, Va.; Ryder, Miami, Fla.; FedEx, Memphis, Tenn.; and Washington University, St. Louis, Mo.   Northrop Grumman Corporation is a $30 billion global defense and technology company whose 120,000 employees provide innovative systems, products, and solutions in information and services, electronics, aerospace and shipbuilding to government and commercial customers worldwide.  -0-  CONTACT:   Christy Whitman             Northrop Grumman Information Technology               (571) 213-5302             Juli Ballesteros, APR             Northrop Grumman Information Technology               (703) 556-2736   (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 08:30 ET (13:30 GMT)

Headline: Lufthansa Confirms Will Hire 3,000 In 2007 >LHA.XE
Story: FRANKFURT (AP)--Airline Deutsche Lufthansa AG (LHA.XE) said Tuesday it would hire 3,000 new staff in 2007, most of them in its home market of Germany.   A spokesman confirmed a report in the Bild newspaper that the company was seeking about 3,000 employees, including 1,200 cabin crew, 800 ground staff and 240 trainee pilots.   About 2,000 of the jobs are at its main hubs of Frankfurt and Munich, the paper said in a report released before its publication Wednesday.   Air transport remains a "real job motor for Germany," Lufthansa Chief Executive Wolfgang Mayrhuber was quoted as saying.   "For that to continue, the infrastructure at German airports must improve urgently, otherwise the new jobs will be in Dubai or somewhere else," Mayrhuber said.   Lufthansa has reported higher passenger numbers in recent months and is forecasting higher underlying earnings for 2006, even as rising fuel costs eat into its bottom line.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 13:29 ET (18:29 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Chile's Cencosud Offers To Pay COP12,400 Per Exito Share
Story: BOGOTA (Dow Jones)--Chilean retailer Cencosud SA (CENCOSUD.SN) offered to pay 12,400 Colombian pesos ($5.56)for each share of Almacenes Exito SA (EXITO.BO) during a tender offer to be carried out in the coming weeks, the Colombian securities regulator said Tuesday.   Cencosud in October agreed to buy a 24.5% stake of Exito from Colombia's Grupo Toro and other shareholders for about $270 million. The company, for regulatory reasons, has to buy the stake through a public tender offer.   According to a previous filing to the regulator sent by investment bank Santander Investment Valores Colombia in November, Cencosud will carry out the tender offer after Jan. 28.   In the filing to the securities regulator, Santander had said the Chilean retailer would offer COP12,500 a share, minus possible dividends distributed by Exito between October 2006 and 10 days after the public tender offer.   The peso strengthened 3.2% between the two announcements.   The price offered by Cencosud is 21% lower than the last closing price of the share. Exito closed at COP15,600 on Thursday, the last trading day in 2006.   Eduardo Reyes, who manages a fund of shares and bonds with local brokerage Asesores en Valores, said no one besides Grupo Toro will have any interest in selling their shares. Reyes holds Exito shares.   After the regulator's statement, the stock exchange suspended trading in Exito shares until a day after the publication of the details of the tender offer.   According to press reports, French retailer Casino Guichard-Perrachon (12558.FR), which owns a 38.6% stake in Exito, may block Cencosud's bid, but the French company declined to comment on its intentions. Existing shareholders have until Jan. 17 to decide if they will exercise the preferential right to buy shares.   Exito has a market share of almost 40% in Colombia, with outlets in 32 cities there and more than 345,000 square meters of retail space. It also has assets in Venezuela.   According to the securities regulator, other Exito minority shareholders include the country's largest holding, Suramericana de Inversiones (SURAMINV.BO), which through its various divisions holds a 8.17% stake.   Banco Santander Central Hispano SA (STD) owns a 2.86% stake in Exito.   Exito last August launched a bid to take over rival Carulla Vivero SA (CARULLA.BO). The Colombian antitrust agency already authorized this takeover.   Cencosud shares fell 0.9% to 1,650 Chilean pesos ($3.10) in trading late Tuesday.     -By Inti Landauro, Dow Jones Newswires; 571-600-1980, colombia@dowjones.com   (Stephan Kuffner contributed to this report.)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 13:38 ET (18:38 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: STREET MOVES: Sanford Bernstein Names New Legal Head
Story: By Evelyn Juan     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--New York-based research firm Sanford C. Bernstein & Co. has hired Cathleen Shine, former deputy general counsel at Jefferies & Co. (JEF), to handle its legal issues.   Shine returns Tuesday to the AllianceBernstein Holding LP (AB) unit, where she previously worked as director of compliance before taking other posts at Wall Street firms and the National Association of Securities Dealers.   John Myers, a spokesman at AllianceBernstein, confirmed Shine's move to join as senior vice president in charge of the brokerage firm's legal function, but couldn't provide information about whether she is taking a new post or replacing someone.   Shine joins Sanford Bernstein after spending three years at Jefferies, which she left in October. Prior to her stint there, Shine served as district director at the NASD, where she managed the membership application process, examination programs and operations of the regulatory body's flagship District 10 office in New York.   Shine also served as assistant general counsel at Goldman Sachs & Co. (GS).   AllianceBernstein's third-quarter revenue in institutional research services came to almost $88 million, down 3.6% from the prior year's third-quarter figures. Chief Executive Lewis Sanders said the decline was due primarily to pan-European clients. "While disappointing, the fundamentals of this business remain intact," Sanders said in a prepared statement in October.   In February 2006, Sanford Bernstein and one of its high-profile analysts, Charles "Brad" Hintz, were fined by the NASD a combined $550,000 for stock trading activity that allegedly violated research analyst conflict of interest rules.   -By Evelyn Juan, Dow Jones Newswires; 201-938-2312; evelyn.juan@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 17:24 ET (22:24 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : S&P Rates Spectra Energy BBB+; Otlk Stable
Story: The following is a press release from Standard & Poor's:     NEW YORK (Standard & Poor's) Jan. 2, 2007--Standard & Poor's Ratings Services today assigned its 'BBB+' corporate credit rating to Spectra Energy Corp, a new holding company that will own Spectra Energy Capital LLC (f/k/a Duke Capital LLC), as Duke Energy Corp. (BBB/Positive/--) separates its electric and natural gas businesses.   Standard & Poor's also raised its corporate credit rating on Spectra Energy Capital (f/k/a Duke Capital LLC) to 'BBB+' from 'BBB'.   The outlook is stable.   Duke Energy created Spectra Energy to facilitate the spin-off of the gas business to existing Duke Energy shareholders. The distribution ratio will be one share of Spectra Energy for every two shares of Duke Energy. Duke Energy received a private letter ruling from the IRS that the transaction is a tax-free spin-off.   "The stable outlook on Spectra Energy reflects the company's strong business risk profile that can withstand some cash flow volatility as the company pursues proposed growth opportunities at its various businesses," said Standard & Poor's credit analyst Dimitri Nikas.   The ratings on Spectra Energy reflect a strong business risk profile combined with a financial profile that has intermediate risk.   Spectra Energy owns natural gas transmission and gas storage assets in the U.S., natural gas distribution and storage assets in Ontario, and natural gas transmission and processing in British Columbia.   Complete ratings information is available to subscribers of RatingsDirect, the real-time Web-based source for Standard & Poor's credit ratings, research, and risk analysis, at www.ratingsdirect.com. All ratings affected by this rating action can be found on Standard & Poor's public Web site at www.standardandpoors.com; under Credit Ratings in the left navigation bar, select Find a Rating, then Credit Ratings Search.   Primary Credit Analyst: Dimitri Nikas, New York (1) 212-438-7807;                  dimitri_nikas@standardandpoors.com Secondary Credit Analyst: Plana Lee, New York (1) 212-438-3119;                    plana_lee@standardandpoors.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 14:56 ET (19:56 GMT)

Headline: : Ag Growth Income Fund Announces Completion of Strategic Acquisition
Story: WINNIPEG, MANITOBA -- (MARKET WIRE) -- 01/02/07 --    Ag Growth Income Fund (TSX: AFN.UN) ("Ag Growth" or the "Fund") announced today the successful completion of its previously announced acquisition of substantially all of the assets of Hansen Manufacturing Corp. of Sioux Falls, South Dakota.   Company Profile   Ag Growth is a leading manufacturer of portable grain handling and conditioning equipment, including augers, belt conveyors, grain handling accessories and grain aeration equipment. Ag Growth's sales, marketing, and distribution system includes approximately 1,400 dealers and distributors in 48 states and nine provinces.   Non-GAAP measures   References to "EBITDA" are to earnings before interest, income taxes, depreciation, and amortization. Management believes that, in addition to net income or loss, EBITDA is a useful supplemental measure in evaluating its performance. Specifically, management believes that EBITDA is the appropriate measure from which to make adjustments to determine the Fund's distributable cash. EBITDA is not a financial measure recognized by Canadian generally accepted accounting principles ("GAAP") and does not have a standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP. Management cautions investors that EBITDA should not replace net income or loss as an indicator of performance, or cash flows from operating, investing, and financing activities as a measure of the Fund's liquidity and cash flows. The Fund's method of calculating EBITDA may differ from the methods used by other issuers.   Distributable cash is a non-GAAP measure generally used by Canadian income funds as an indicator of financial performance. The Fund defines distributable cash as EBITDA less interest expense, maintenance capital expenditures, and current taxes. Distributable cash is not a financial measure recognized by Canadian generally accepted accounting principles ("GAAP") and does not have a standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP. The method of calculating the Fund's distributable cash may differ from similar computations as reported by similar entities and, accordingly, may not be comparable to distributable cash as reported by such entities.   Forward-Looking Statements   The statements contained in this news release may contain forward-looking statements that reflect our expectations regarding the future growth, results of operations, performance and business prospects, and opportunities of the Fund. Forward-looking statements contain such words as "anticipate", "believe", "continue", "could", "expects", "intend", "plans" or similar expressions suggesting future conditions or events. Such forward-looking statements reflect our current beliefs and are based on information currently available to us. Forward-looking statements involve significant risks and uncertainties. A number of factors could cause actual results to differ materially from results discussed in the forward-looking statements, including changes in national and local business conditions, decreased crop yields, industry cyclicality, and competition. These risks and uncertainties are fully described in our 2005 Annual Report and our Annual Information Form dated March 16, 2006. Further information about these and other risks and uncertainties can be found in the disclosure documents filed by Ag Growth Income Fund with the securities regulatory authorities, available at www.sedar.com.      Contacts: Ag Growth Income Fund Steve Sommerfeld Investor Relations (204) 489-1855 Email: steve@aggrowth.com   (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 12:29 ET (17:29 GMT)

Headline: : Mavrix Fund December Net Redemptions C$7.2M >MVX.T
Story: TORONTO, Jan. 2 /CNW/ - Mavrix Fund Management Inc. (TSX: MVX) today reported Assets under Management (AUM) and sales for the month ending December 31, 2006. Total AUM increased by 2.96% in December to $686.4 million and a 15.57% increase compared to December 31, 2005. Mavrix did not renew two administrative contracts that had expired during the month and will only report AUM going forward. "Given the lower margins of third party work and the timing, we decided it was best to devote all our administrative capacity to our core business-Mavrix mutual funds and Mavrix resource limited partnerships," said David Balsdon, Vice President and Secretary-Treasurer.    Mavrix reported Net Redemptions of $7.2 million on Gross Sales of $4.9 million for Mavrix Mutual Funds for the month ended December 31, 2006. Mavrix funds with a high percentage of income trust holdings accounted for most of the redemption activity in December.    Mavrix also announced the filing of the preliminary prospectus of the Mavrix Explore Quebec 2007-I FT Limited Partnership (the "LP") on December 21, 2006. The LP will invest in a diversified portfolio of flow-through shares issued primarily by mining companies with exploration activities in the province of Quebec.    "Strong market returns over the month for our funds helped downplay some lingering income trust taxation announcement related redemption activity," added Balsdon, "in fact, total gross sales for Mavrix mutual funds in 2006 were 20.6% greater than 2005."          <<      -------------------------------------------------------------------------                         Assets as at        Assets as at         Assets as at                    December 31, 2006   December 31, 2005    December 31, 2004      -------------------------------------------------------------------------      Mavrix Mutual      $493,163,106        $438,087,328         $366,446,414      Funds      -------------------------------------------------------------------------      Specialty Funds    $193,223,889        $155,813,316         $128,114,910      -------------------------------------------------------------------------      Total Assets       $686,386,995        $593,900,644         $494,561,324      -------------------------------------------------------------------------      -------------------------------------------------------------------------      >>      Mavrix Fund Management Inc. is a growing Canadian asset management company with shares listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange. Headline: : Verizon Wireless Completes $180 Million in Philadelphia Region Network Enhancements in 2006
Story: $800 Million Invested Since 2000 Bringing Local Customers Reliable Service, Expanded Coverage and High-Speed Wireless Broadband Services       TREVOSE, Pa., Jan. 2 /PRNewswire/ -- Verizon Wireless, operator of the nation's most reliable wireless network, today announced it has completed nearly $180 million in network enhancements in the Philadelphia Tri-State Region this past year and more than $800 million since 2000.     The company's regional investment across eastern Pennsylvania, southern New Jersey and Delaware is part of more than $35 billion invested nationwide in the past seven years. Local network enhancements included adding and upgrading cell sites and a new switching facility to improve call handling capacity and quality, increasing coverage and expanding wireless broadband services for business and consumer use.     The company also continued to invest in redundancy capabilities designed to keep the network operating during power outages and in its rigorous quality assurance program - daily testing designed to analyze network reliability and assist the company in targeting improvements.     "Investment in our network is an investment in customer satisfaction," said Christine Baron, president of the company's Philadelphia Tri-State Region.  "An outstanding customer experience begins with connecting and holding calls, and customers continue to choose Verizon Wireless because we have the nation's most reliable wireless voice and data network."     Strong demand for Verizon Wireless services continued during 2006 as the company set new records for net new customers - more than 5.4 million during the first three quarters of the year - and improved upon its customer retention rates, the best in the industry.     During 2006, the expansion of the company's Evolution-Data Optimized (EV- DO) third generation (3G) wide-area network fueled an explosion of new high- speed broadband services for consumers and businesses. Mobile professionals throughout much of the region can now enjoy an "untethered" mobile office experience, enabling them to wirelessly access their calendars, E-mail and critical business information residing behind corporate firewalls. In addition, VCAST entertainment services have transformed Verizon Wireless phones allowing local consumers to carry a single multifunctional device providing access to downloadable music, high-quality videos, cool 3D games and even turn-by-turn navigation services.        Other local network upgrades in 2006 included:         -- Continued expansion of company's wireless broadband network          throughout the region, including Philadelphia and suburbs, the Lehigh          Valley, the state capitals of Trenton, N.J. and Dover, Del.; along          the Jersey shoreline and at the major airports across the Tri-State          Region. The wireless broadband service is available to about 90% of          the region's population with expansion to continue in 2007.       -- Significant expansion of the company's mobile switching facility in          Wilmington, Del. to handle the growing demand for wireless voice and          data services in the state.       The company's investment in its Philadelphia region reflects its commitment to offer customers the most reliable wireless service available. The company's 'most reliable network' reputation is based on network studies performed by real-life test men and test women.  Test men and test women are Verizon Wireless engineers who drive specially equipped vehicles some 220,000 miles quarterly on Interstate, U.S. and state highways as well as major and secondary roads. Test vehicles are equipped with computers that automatically make more than 750,000 voice call attempts and more than one million data tests quarterly on the Verizon Wireless network and the networks of other carriers.  The engineers are the inspiration for the company's memorable national advertising campaign.     "As the fastest-growing wireless company with the highest loyalty rate, it is important we continue to make significant investments in our network to stay ahead of the growing demands of our customers," Baron said. "In 2007, we will continue to invest in our network and deliver the reliable and innovative services customers want."        About Verizon Wireless     Verizon Wireless operates the nation's most reliable wireless voice and data network, serving 57 million customers. The largest US wireless company and largest wireless data provider, based on revenues, Verizon Wireless is headquartered in Basking Ridge, N.J., with 60,000 employees nationwide. The company is a joint venture of Verizon Communications (NYSE: VZ) and Vodafone (NYSE: VOD; London). Find more information on the Web at http://www.verizonwireless.com. To preview and request broadcast-quality video footage and high-resolution stills of Verizon Wireless operations, log on to the Verizon Wireless Multimedia Library at http://www.verizonwireless.com/multimedia.    SOURCE  Verizon Wireless       /CONTACT: Sheldon Jones of Verizon Wireless, +1-215-638-5668, +1-215-219-8890 (cell), Sheldon.jones@verizonwireless.com; or Carly Irwin for Verizon Wireless, +1-215-790-4342      /Web site: http://www.verizonwireless.com      /Web site: http://www.verizonwireless.com/multimedia     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 10:25 ET (15:25 GMT)

Headline: : New Mackenzie Founders Fund Brings Together Four Of Mackenzie's Most Recognized Funds>IGM.T
Story: TORONTO, Jan. 2 /CNW/ - Mackenzie Investments today announced the launch of Mackenzie Founders Fund (the Fund), an equity fund of funds investment solution that provides investors with equal exposure to four of Mackenzie's longest standing and most notable funds: Mackenzie Growth Fund, Mackenzie Cundill Value Fund, Mackenzie Maxxum Dividend Fund and Mackenzie Ivy Foreign Equity Fund.    The Fund gives investors easy access to seasoned management teams, all of whom have a history of stable returns with solid growth potential. Mackenzie will automatically rebalance the funds to help ensure the allocations remain within specified ranges across the four funds.    "Mackenzie Founders Fund provides investors access to four long-standing and proven investment vehicles in one simple solution," said David Feather, president, Mackenzie Financial Services Inc. "It's fitting that we mark our fortieth anniversary in 2007 with the launch of a fund that embodies a long history of investment leadership across four distinct Mackenzie brands."    Successful track record    Mackenzie Founders Fund brings together the signature fund within four unique Mackenzie brands. Each fund was selected based on its successful long-term track record as a founding fund within its respective brand and how its investment style complements the other funds. With over 100 combined years of investment management experience, the portfolio managers behind Mackenzie Founders Fund have proven track records and are highly recognized in the investment industry.          <<        -  Mackenzie Growth Fund - Established in 1967 and Mackenzie's first           mutual fund. Run by award-winning manager Fred Sturm and his team,           this fund invests in themes and sectors from around the world           offering quality, growth and value. Now invests up to 49% of its           assets outside of Canada.          -  Mackenzie Cundill Value Fund - Established in 1974 along with the           founding of the Cundill Funds organization. Run by renowned value           manager Peter Cundill and his team, the fund seeks long-term growth           from undervalued investments across the globe.          -  Mackenzie Maxxum Dividend Fund - Established in 1986 among the           original group of funds under the Maxxum brand. Managed by dividend           veteran Bill Procter and the Maxxum team, this Canadian dividend           fund aims to generate attractive yields and capital appreciation.          -  Mackenzie Ivy Foreign Equity Fund - Established in 1992 with the           introduction of the Ivy Fund family. Run by veteran manager Jerry           Javasky and the Ivy team, the fund invests in select, high-calibre,           multi-national companies around the world.      >>      Expert oversight    Mackenzie senior vice president Karen Bleasby will be responsible for the oversight of the Fund. The Fund will be rebalanced using daily cash flows, but Bleasby will also have the option to manually rebalance the portfolio if necessary. Bleasby's participation on this Fund maintains the alignment of Mackenzie's multi-managed products under the direction of a single oversight team.    The Fund may be suitable for investors with a medium tolerance for risk who seek long-term capital growth. Interested investors should contact their financial advisor for more information    Mackenzie Investments: Mackenzie Investments was founded in 1967 and is a leading investment management firm providing investment advisory and related services. With $60 billion in assets under management, Mackenzie Investments distributes its services through a diversified network of third-party financial advisors. Mackenzie Investments is a member of the IGM Financial Inc. (TSX: IGM) group of companies. IGM Financial is one of Canada's premier financial services companies with over $116 billion in total assets under management.         /CONTACT: Catharine Marion, Environics Communications, (416) 969-2809, cmarion@environicspr.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 16:48 ET (21:48 GMT)

Headline: : Airspan and CGC Successfully Deploy WiMAX and Wi-Fi With Qatar Telecom at the 15th Asian Games Doha 2006
Story: BOCA RATON, FL -- (MARKET WIRE) -- 01/02/07 --    Airspan Networks Inc (NASDAQ: AIRN) today announced it successfully deployed its world-leading combined WiMAX/Wi-Fi solution at the 15th Asian Games in Doha, Qatar. The network was built and operated by Airspan and its partner, Consolidated Gulf Co. W.L.L. ("CGC"), for Qatar Telecom ("QTel").   Qatar Telecom (QTEL), which is an existing Airspan AS4020 customer, selected Airspan's WiMAX/Wi-Fi solution from a joint proposal submitted in a competitive tender process by Airspan and CGC.  Airspan supplied its MacroMAX and MicroMAX -- System-on-a-Chip ("SOC") base stations, which connected to 300 ProST / Wi-Fi customer access points to create HotZones across the sites where the Games took place.  The MicroMAX-SOC, Airspan's latest WiMAX base station, is the first low-cost WiMAX solution to be sold to the carrier, enterprise, and defense markets.   The network was used to provide international news media with high-speed Internet access for data, VoIP and multimedia (picture/video clips) transmissions. Users obtained Internet access primarily through the Wi-Fi HotZones, which were backhauled by WiMAX to the Internet.  Direct WiMAX access was also available for high-bandwidth applications. The network provided viewers with real-time, live news updates, and instant event coverage through the uploading to media websites of pictures and recorded video clips for special events.   Commenting on this highly successful, high-profile deployment, Eric Stonestrom, CEO of Airspan Networks, said that, "Airspan was delighted to have been chosen by QTel for the very important task of providing broadbandwireless connectivity to the world's leading media during the fifteen days of games in Doha. With CGC as our partner, we worked tirelessly to ensure that the solution set the standard by which internet connectivity and communications at other events will be measured."   Mr. Anil Mahajan, Head of Business Development of CGC, said: "Airspan's world-class WiMAX/Wi-Fi solution was the ideal platform to provide a broadband wireless solution on the mass scale required for the Games. CGC successfully integrated WiMAX into QTel's core IP network, and the solution enabled thousands of stories, pictures and videos to be sent out by world's media, communicating in real time the dramatic events and spectacle that the games created."   "We are pleased to have been part of QTEL's WiMAX broadband wireless accessnetwork during the 15th Asian Games 2006. We provided a total turnkey solution and ensured high speed NLOS broad band wireless access and high capacity backhaul to numerous WiFi Access Points. Our fully integrated WiMAX Forum Certified ProST WiMAX/WiFi integrated outdoor CPE solution was deployed at all games venues spread throughout Doha. I would like to take this opportunity to highlight that we are impressed by QTel's progressive initiative and vision of providing ubiquitous broadband wireless access services in Qatar.  While others are planning or trialing WiMAX in the region, QTEL did it. And being the leading telecom operator is undoubtedly the first telecom operator in the region to successfully deploy WiMAX on such a large scale. This is indeed an excellent landmark achievement by QTEL and we are proud to be part of it," said Rizwan Butt, Director Sales for Middle East and North Africa of Airspan Networks Inc., Dubai, UAE.   After the conclusion of the Games, the Airspan network was re-deployed in the city of Doha and at other locations in Qatar, and will provide a lasting legacy of high performance broadband wireless for the citizens of Qatar.   WiMAX(TM), WiMAX Forum(TM) and WiMAX Forum Certified(TM) are trademarks of the WiMAX Forum.   About Airspan Networks Inc.   Airspan Networks provides fixed and wireless voice and data systems and solutions, including Voice Over IP (VoIP). Its wireless products serve operators around the world in both licensed and unlicensed frequency bands between 700 MHz and 6 GHz, including both PCS and 3.5GHz international bands. Airspan has a strong wireless product roadmap that includes products meeting 802.11 a/b/g Wi-Fi standards, and WiMAX Forum Certified(TM) equipment that includes software upgradeability to the Mobile WiMAX(TM) 802.16e-2005 standard. Airspan is on the Board and is a founder member of the WiMAX Forum and a member of the Wi-Fi Alliance. The Company has deployments in more than 100 countries with more than 400 operators, 100 of which use Airspan's WiMAX Forum Certified(TM) and non-certified products. Airspan's wireless systems are based on radio technology that delivers excellent area coverage, high security and resistance to fading. Thesesystems can be deployed rapidly and cost effectively, providing an attractive alternative to traditional wired communications networks. Airspan's AS.TONE VoIP system is a carrier class, turnkey solution that provides carriers with Class 4, Class 5 and IP-Centrex solutions and has a Softswitch and Gateways supporting SIP/H323 and SIP. AS.Tone's design provides customers, carriers, next-generation telcos, cellular providers and ITSP with a wide range of solutions with the best price/performance system for IP telephony. Airspan also offers radio planning, network installation, integration, training and support services to facilitate the deployment and operation of its systems. Airspan is headquartered in Boca Raton, Florida with its main operations center in Uxbridge, United Kingdom.   More information on Airspan can be found at http://www.airspan.com   This press release contains forward-looking statements within the meaning of Section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933 and Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.  All statements, other than statements of historical facts, including statements regarding our strategy, future operations, financial position, future revenues, projected costs, prospects, plans and objectives of management, may be deemed to be forward-looking statements. The words "anticipates," "believes," "estimates," "expects," "intends," "may," "plans," "projects," "will," "would" and similar expressions or negative variations thereof are intended to identify forward-looking statements, although not all forward-lookingstatements contain these identifying words.  We may not actually achieve the plans, intentions or expectations disclosed in our forward-looking statements and you should not place undue reliance on our forward-looking statements. There are a number of important factors that could cause actual results or events to differ materially from the plans, intentions and expectations disclosed in the forward-looking statements we make. Investors and others are therefore cautioned that a variety of factors, including certain risks, may affect our business and cause actual results to differ materially from those set forth in the forward-looking statements. Theserisk factors include, without limitation, (i) a slowdown of expenditures bycommunication service providers; (ii) increased competition from alternative communication systems; (iii) the failure of our existing or prospective customers to purchase products as projected; (iv) our inability to successfully implement cost reduction or containment programs; (v) the potential loss of Axtel and Yozan as our largest customers; and specific to this press release, (vi) our potential inability to locate and secure additional sources of capital at the time and in the amount needed; (vii) the possibility that Yozan will materially delay or cancel future equipment orders; (viii) our inability to cancel certain component orders and/or to use or sell any excess inventory we accumulate as a result of the Yozan contract amendment; and (ix) disruption to our operations in Israel, including the absence of employees due to required military service caused by political and military tensions in Israel and the Middle East. The Company is subject to the risks and uncertainties described in its filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, including its Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended 31 December, 2005 and on its Form 10-Q for the quarters ended April 2, 2006, July 2, 2006 and October 1, 2006. We do not assume any obligation to update any forward-looking statements.      For Investment and Media Inquiries, contact: Airspan Networks Peter Aronstam Senior Vice President & Chief Financial Officer Airspan Networks, Inc. Tel: +1 561 893-8682 Fax: +1 561 893-8681 Email: paronstam@airspan.com   (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 07:23 ET (12:23 GMT)

Headline: : Covanta Announces Start of Design and Construction of Hillsborough County, Florida Waste-to-Energy Facility Expansion
Story: Expansion will increase the facility's capacity to provide the   citizens with a climate-friendly alternative for their waste and                             energy needs  FAIRFIELD, N.J.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 02, 2007--   Covanta Energy Corporation, a subsidiary of Covanta Holding Corporation (NYSE: CVA), announced it has received authorization from Hillsborough County to commence design and construction of a 50 percent capacity expansion of the Hillsborough County, FL Solid Waste-to-Energy Facility located near Brandon, FL. The 600 ton per day (TPD) capacity expansion to the existing County-owned 1,200 TPD waste-to-energy facility will be built and operated by Covanta Hillsborough, Inc., an operating subsidiary of Covanta Energy Corporation.     Covanta will oversee the design, construction and start-up of the expansion. Under the terms of the extension operations and management agreement, Covanta will operate both the expansion and the original facility, which Covanta has been successfully operating since 1987, for another 20 years. The facility serves as an integral component of the comprehensive solid waste management plan of Hillsborough Country. As outlined in the terms of the extension agreement, Covanta will operate and maintain the expanded facility though 2027 to deliver County residents with environmentally-sound waste disposal and clean, renewable energy.     "We look forward to continuing our long-standing partnership with Hillsborough County as we work to complete the expansion of this facility. The County's decision to expand reinforces the strategic role waste-to-energy plays in recovering energy and materials from the waste stream to further reduce reliance on landfilling. Covanta recognizes that climate change is a real and growing challenge, and data has shown that modern waste-to-energy facilities such as this one reduce green house gas emissions by preventing methane production from waste landfills and offsetting the use of fossil fuels for energy production," said Anthony J. Orlando, President and Chief Executive Officer of Covanta.       About Covanta Holding Corporation:     Covanta Holding Corporation is a New York Stock Exchange listed company engaging in waste disposal, energy services and specialty insurance through its subsidiaries. Covanta's subsidiary, Covanta Energy Corporation, is an internationally recognized owner and operator of waste-to-energy and power generation projects. Covanta Energy's waste-to-energy facilities convert municipal solid waste into renewable energy for numerous communities, predominantly in the United States. Headline: AT&T Sterling Unit CEO Starr Dies; Irwin Named Acting CEO
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   AT&T Inc. (T) said Samuel Starr, president and chief executive of its Sterling Commerce unit, died Dec. 31 after a sudden illness.   The company named Bob Irwin acting president and chief executive of Sterling Commerce.   The telecommunication holding company said Starr, 47 years old, was hospitalized Dec. 24 with a sudden, serious illness. He was married and had six children.   AT&T said Sterling's executive team had continued normal operations since Starr's hospitalization, and it does not anticipate any effect on product delivery or services or on any ongoing acquisition discussions.   -Sara Leitch; 201-938-5400; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 09:22 ET (14:22 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Brazil Petrobras Shares Up After New Areas Declared Viable
Story: RIO DE JANEIRO (Dow Jones)--Stocks in Brazil's state-run oil firm Petroleo Brasileiro SA (PBR), or Petrobras, posted healthy gains early Tuesday after the company Friday declared 19 new oil and gas areas commercially viable.   The areas have a combined estimated oil and gas reserves of 2.1 billion barrelsof oil equivalent, or BOE, Petrobras said in a release Friday.   Petrobras stocks rose 1.13% to BRL49.90 ($1=BRL2.135) at 1402 GMT, while the Ibovespa index of most traded stocks in Sao Paulo, was up 1.16%.   "The announcement was quite positive and comes in line with reserve increases in recent years," said Monica Araujo, oil analyst at the Ativa brokerage in Rio de Janeiro. "They still have a lot of fields to incorporate into reserves."   Yet, Araujo added that Petrobras probably won't be able to book the new areas as reserves for 2006 according to the strict criteria of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, or SEC.   The company is slated to announce its 2006 reserves in the latter half of January, and its 2007 reserves in early 2008.   "But Petrobras probably will be able to include most of the areas next year," Araujo said.   The SEC among other requirements demands oil companies to have firm oil sale contracts for new fields to be considered company reserves.   According to SEC criteria, Petrobras' domestic oil and gas reserves stood at 10.578 billion BOE at the end of 2005, up 1% from a year earlier. Of that, 9.034 billion BOE were from oil. Petrobras overseas reserves fell to 1.681 billion BOE in 2005 from 1.872 billion BOE in 2004.   According to the less strict criteria of the Society of Petroleum Engineers, or SPE, Petrobras' 2005 Brazilian reserves rose to 13.232 billion BOE from 13.023 billion BOE in 2004. Of that, 11.364 billion barrels were oil reserves.   The SPE also accepts as reserves areas in earlier stages of development.   Petrobras' overseas oil and gas reserves, according to SPE criteria, fell to 1.681 billion BOE in 2005, down from 1.872 billion BOE in 2004.   A company press official Tuesday said Petrobras hopes to include at least a great part of the areas now declared commercially viable as reserves under SPE criteria.   Petrobras on Friday had said 16 of the new areas were located offshore and three areas were located onshore.   The 16 offshore areas are located at three Atlantic Ocean sites off the coasts of southeastern Brazil.   The greatest amount of new reserves will be added to the Campos Basin off the Rio de Janeiro coast, where Petrobras estimates eight new areas to add reserves of 1.37 billion BOE. In one of the areas, the Maromba field in the BC-20 block, U.S. oil firm Chevron Corp. (CVX) has a participation, Petrobras said.   Another 560 million BOE in estimated new reserves will come from the Santos Basin off the Sao Paulo coast, most near the Mexilhao gas field where Petrobras plans to start output in early 2009.   Petrobras also has a 40% stake in the BS-4 block in the Santos Basin, which Royal Dutch Shell PLC (RDSB.LN) Thursday declared to be commercially viable. Shell is lead operator in that block with a 40% stake, while Chevron also holds 20%. The BS-4 is estimated to contain reserves of about 300 million barrels of very heavy crude.   The remainder of Petrobras' new areas will come from its most recent oil province off the coast of Espirito Santo state, where the company estimates new reserves to amount to 168 million BOE.     -By Bernd Radowitz, Dow Jones Newswires; +5521-3288-5004; bernd.radowitz@dowjones.com;     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 09:16 ET (14:16 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Hilb Rogal & Hobbs Completes Acquisition of Glencairn Group Limited
Story: RICHMOND, Va.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 02, 2007--   Hilb Rogal & Hobbs Company (NYSE: HRH), the world's tenth largest insurance and risk management intermediary, announced that effective January 1, 2007, it has completed the previously announced acquisition of the stock of London-based Glencairn Group Limited (Glencairn). Terms of the transaction were not disclosed.     Glencairn is an independent Lloyd's insurance and reinsurance broker group with over 150 employees headquartered in London and throughout its three offices in South Africa, Russia and Australia. Providing a broad spectrum of wholesale and retail products and services in the property, casualty, reinsurance, financial, professional, accident & health, and specialty areas, including political risks and cargo, Glencairn expects 2006 annualized revenues of approximately USD 39 million (GBP 20 million). Also effective January 1, 2007, Glencairn's former Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, Steve Hearn, was appointed CEO of both his current staff and the staff of HRH's existing London operations.     HRH Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Martin L. (Mell) Vaughan, III, said, "With the acquisition of Glencairn, we were able to further our strategic objectives by expanding our wholesale and reinsurance capabilities. In addition, this organization brings immense talent and leadership to HRH's existing London branch, as well as increased access to the Lloyd's of London and other critical international underwriting markets. We are excited to officially welcome Steve Hearn and his associates to our organization."     Hilb Rogal & Hobbs Company is the eighth largest insurance intermediary in the United States, with over 120 offices throughout the United States and London. HRH helps clients manage their risks in property and casualty, employee benefits, professional liability and other areas of specialized exposure. In addition, HRH offers a full range of personal and corporate financial products and services. HRH is focused on understanding our clients' businesses, employees and risks, as well as the insurance and financial markets, so that we can develop insurance, risk management and employee benefits solutions that best fit their needs. The company's common stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange, symbol HRH. More information about HRH may be found at www.hrh.com. Headline: Google, EarthLink Near Deal For San Francisco Net - Sources
Story: By Ben Charny     After months of negotiations, Internet search leader Google Inc. (GOOG) and partner EarthLink Inc. (ELNK), the Internet service provider, are "very close" to finalizing terms of a deal to build a San Francisco-wide wireless Internet network, sources said Tuesday.   San Francisco is trying to join the growing numbers of major U.S. cities that make available free, and relatively low cost, Internet access using Wi-Fi, a popular wireless technology. An agreement on contract terms means both sides have overcome a major hurdle after more than nine months of sometime acrimonious negotiations.   But the process is by no means over. Before construction on the network could begin, the contract terms must be approved by the city's board of supervisors. Also, according to the sources, while an official announcement could happen as early as this week, they cautioned the negotiations could fall apart on any number of issues.   "We're close, very close," said one of two sources speaking about the pending deal. Another source, familiar with EarthLink's stance, said "this could happen this week." Both were granted anonymity because they weren't supposed to be talking publicly about the deal.   Representatives from Mayor Gavin Newsom's office didn't reply to requests Tuesday seeking comment. An EarthLink (ELNK) spokesman had no comment and a Google representative referred comment to EarthLink.   The proposed network in San Francisco would have two components; one would make available, for free, a high-speed Internet network supported by advertisements appearing on computer or laptop screens logged onto the network.   The Google and EarthLink proposal also calls for selling a faster, commercial-free wireless Internet service in San Francisco for $20 a month.   San Francisco's leadership is trying to create opportunity for more of its citizens to derive the economic benefits from using the Internet. San Francisco's leadership also wants to the city's reputation as a technology-friendly city.   EarthLink hopes to profit from this venture, and other municipal-wide wireless networks it is now building, by extending its Internet services to a bigger, more captive audiences.   Google's motivations aren't as crystal clear, although the company would clearly benefit from serving up ads to free Internet users. Google also operates a city-wide wireless network, on its own, in its hometown of Mountain View.   In April, San Francisco formally began negotiations with the Google/EarthLink partnership, after choosing their joint proposal from a list of five others that were submitted.   Almost immediately, privacy advocates including those from the American Civil Liberties Union raised concerns about Google's involvement, questioning whether that meant the network would be tracking users' whereabouts.   Google acknowledge it was possible to track users and, if done so, it would ostensibly be done as a way to tailor the ads that would appear to mirror a business someone's close to.   While Google and EarthLink say privacy concerns are baseless, a San Francisco-based privacy group earlier this year submitted to the city guidelines and minimum standards it considers necessary for protecting people's privacy.   In September, frustrations over the slow pace of the negotiations apparently boiled over.   Chris Sacca, head of Google's special projects, said in an interview published in the San Francisco Chronicle that talks hadn't advanced for months, and city officials have made unreasonable demands such as free computers and a revenue share.   -Ben Charny; 415-439-6400; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 14:51 ET (19:51 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: FOCUS: Hedge Funds Face Risks In Changing Credit Markets
Story: By Margot Patrick     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     LONDON (Dow Jones)--Hedge-fund managers who take bets on the likelihood of companies defaulting on their debt could benefit this year if a slowing economy and rising interest rates hit corporate earnings - though some funds could collapse from risks they took when few companies were having trouble repaying their debt.   A declining rate of defaults since 2002 has attracted trillions of investment dollars to the world's markets for loans, bonds and credit derivatives.   Hundreds of hedge funds - lightly regulated investment vehicles that traditionally targeted the ultra-rich as well as institutional investors such as pension funds - have been created to trade in default risk, with strategies ranging from straightforward loans to companies to complex derivatives trades.   Some who track the industry estimate that credit hedge funds now control about $100 billion in assets.   Collecting premiums for insuring investors against default has been a winning strategy as companies benefited from stronger economies and lower debt-servicing costs.   Average returns at credit hedge funds have been about 11% a year since 2002, about the same as other hedge-fund strategies, data provider Hedge Fund Research estimates.   Although analysts are predicting yields will rise by the end of the year, credit hedge funds are continuing to attract investors. The idea is that they can devise winning strategies no matter the state of companies' finances because of the many different ways they can buy or sell credit risk.   Hedge funds specializing in distressed debt could do particularly well, after slim pickings in troubled companies bonds and loans over the past few years, analysts say.   The expectation that a turn in credit quality will create more investment opportunities for hedge-fund managers is one reason why Commerzbank AG in December launched a fixed-income fund of hedge funds investing with at least 15 managers in fixed-income and credit strategies.   "Credit markets have had such a good run, clearly, but no one expects that to last. As and when we start seeing the credit market become choppy and the element of uncertainty kicks in, hedge funds will come into their own," said Mehraj Mattoo, global head of alternative investment strategies at Commerzbank.   Regulators and ratings agencies aren't so sure. They have cautioned that hedge funds could exacerbate the effects of more companies struggling to make debt repayments, shaking the "wall of money" that has helped bring risk premiums on corporate bonds near all-time lows.   One worry is that price moves in corporate bonds or derivatives could be amplified by hedge funds needing to meet margin calls on positions they finance with borrowed money.   "That is the big unwind scenario. To meet margin calls on illiquid instruments, hedge funds will have to sell their liquid assets," said Ed Eyerman, a managing director at Fitch Ratings in London.   Credit markets have looked like a one-way bet for both hedge funds and traditional buy-and-hold investors since the last major wave of defaults around 2002.   Then, the collapses of Enron Corp. and WorldCom Inc. helped push the average yield premium on U.S. high-yield bonds to 9.47 percentage points over risk-free rates. The gap is now around 3.5 percentage points, as the high-yield default rate has fallen from more than 8% in 2002 to around 2% now.   Over that period, hedge funds helped lead a charge into credit markets by investors looking to make money from taking on credit risk. Investment banks responded by introducing products that compartmentalize lending risks, reaping them billions of dollars in fees.   In one measure of the markets' rapid growth, about $400 billion in collateralized debt obligations were issued in the U.S. and Europe in 2006, more than double the amount in 2004.   These pools of debt contracts referencing everything from risky corporate loans to people's credit card payments are crucial to the markets because they fuel the sale of credit default swaps - contracts that pay sellers a premium to insure against a borrower defaulting.   The notional value of those swap contracts was $26 trillion at June 30, according to the International Swaps and Derivatives Association, more than 15-fold the $1.6 trillion in June 2002.   Although CDOs and credit derivatives spread lending risks to a wider number of investors from companies' original lenders, they have also created turmoil in their relatively-short existence.   Credit hedge funds in particular suffered significant losses when spreads on some derivatives products unexpectedly became correlated after the May 2005 junk downgrades of U.S. automakers General Motors Corp. (GM) and Ford Motor Co. (F).   "An economic downturn will test the new synthetic players and products in the corporate bond market. These products and markets are relatively new and, more importantly, have yet to be tested in a bear market," Mark Kiesel, a portfolio manager at Pacific Investment Management Co. wrote in a recent note.   Kiesel said Newport Beach, Calif.-based Pimco, which controls $641 billion in assets, is collecting the difference in prices between companies' bonds and their credit default swaps, because it expects the swaps market to react more sharply if there is a correction in the pricing of default risk.   Ratings agencies also have warned that hedge funds and other investors may be mispricing the risk of some new types of corporate loans. Highly leveraged companies owned by private-equity funds have been heavy issuers of second-lien loans that give holders a secondary claim on a company's collateral. Owned almost exclusively by hedge funds, the loans' performance hasn't been tested through a default cycle.   Patrick Brennan, a London-based portfolio manager on NewFinance Capital's Opus Credit fund of hedge funds, said skilled hedge-fund managers should be able to adapt quickly if there is a significant increase in corporate defaults. Like most credit-market investors, he isn't anticipating that will happen for at least a year or two.   He said his $100 million fund - which returned more than 12% in 2006 after fees - is profiting from managers with stakes in corporate restructurings at U.S. airlines and auto-parts suppliers. Other gains are coming from hedge funds that provide specialty finance such as bridge financing for real-estate development, and from managers who are short-selling against the repayment of mortgages granted to U.S. home buyers with spotty credit.   "We are avoiding derivatives-based strategies and highly levered products because we view those as vulnerable to any significant liquidity squeeze in the market," Brennan said.   -By Margot Patrick, Dow Jones Newswires; +44 20 7842 9451; margot.patrick@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 00:45 ET (05:45 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: 2nd UPDATE:Nucor Makes $1.07B Tender For Harris Steel
Story: (Adds background, analyst's comments on pricing.)       By Christopher Scinta     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--Nucor Corp. (NUE) said it plans to acquire Canadian steel processor Harris Steel Group (HSG.T) for C$1.25 billion (US$1.07 billion), adding to its operations downstream from its steel mills and adding exposure to what has been a strong non-residential construction market.   The Charlotte steel company's C$46.25-a-share tender offer will remain open for at least 35 days and represents a 6.3% premium to Harris' Friday's close. Harris shares ran up from around C$36 earlier this month after the company announced it was in talks that may lead to a sale.   Harris Steel Chairman and Chief Executive John Harris and other members of the Harris family, along with Chief Operating Officer Paul Kelly, have agreed to tender 13.7 million shares, representing more than 50% of Harris Steel stock.   Nucor said Harris had net debt of C$123 million at Sept. 30.   Nucor shares closed on Friday at $54.66, down 1.1%.   Toronto-based Harris supplies steel reinforcing bar for construction projects as well as wire and metal grates.   "The acquisition of Harris Steel Group significantly advances Nucor's downstream growth initiatives," said Nucor Chief Executive Dan DiMicco in a statement. "...Harris Steel provides Nucor with immediate and broad geographical reach and with considerable scale and growth opportunities."   In December, Nucor said its fourth-quarter earnings would be below analyst expectations and cited heavy imports and high inventories that were driving down prices. Other steelmakers including Steel Dynamics Inc. (STLD) and Ipsco Inc. (IPS) have joined Nucor in saying their fourth-quarter results would be hurt as wholesalers worked through their excess inventory.   Steel imports, though they declined in November according to preliminary figures from the Census Bureau, are still expected to reach a record 46 million tons in 2006.   UBS analyst Timna Tanners said in a recent note that steel sheet prices likely reached a bottom at $530 a ton in December, down $100 from the peak over the summer. Prices for long products, such as steel beams and merchant bar, were holding up better than sheet due to "continued relatively robust construction demand," she said.   -By Christopher Scinta,Dow Jones Newswires; 201-938-5218; chris.scinta@dowjones.com   (Jonathan Vuocolo contributed to this report.)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 09:50 ET (14:50 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Harbinger Seeks Shareholder Panel In Granite Ch 11 Case
Story: By Marie Beaudette     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     Harbinger Capital Partners is urging the Manhattan bankruptcy court to form a committee to represent shareholders in the Chapter 11 case of Granite Broadcasting Corp. (GBTVQ), saying the company's plan to transfer control to Silver Point Capital would give the hedge fund a windfall at shareholders' expense.   Harbinger, along with fellow preferred shareholders GoldenTree High Yield Master Fund II Ltd. and MFC Global Investment Management (U.S.) LLC, said the case represents "a classic example" of secured creditors attempting to "grab upside equity value rather than simply seeking to be paid in full."   Granite Broadcasting, which sought Chapter 11 protection last month after reaching a deal with Silver Point and other secured bondholders, "cannot be counted on to protect the interests of the preferred equity holders," the shareholder group said in papers filed Friday with the U.S. Bankruptcy Court in Manhattan.   The shareholders, who hold more than 50% of Granite Broadcasting's 12.75% cumulative exchangeable preferred stock, are pegging the post-bankruptcy enterprise value of the company at a "dramatically" higher level than the $493 million estimate put forth by Granite's own financial adviser.   A representative of Granite Broadcasting declined to comment.   The shareholders, who also want the court to deny Granite's request to borrow an additional $20 million from Silver Point, said the appointment of a committee is necessary to preserve the "substantial value available for holders of the preferred equity."   According to court papers, an analysis conducted by investment bank Chanin Capital Partners L.P. puts Granite's enterprise value at between $630.9 million and $698 million, which would provide value to the preferred shareholders of between $19.4 million and $101.5 million.   The shareholder group called Chanin's estimate "conservative" and said Granite's Chapter 11 reorganization plan is based on a flawed valuation from financial adviser Houlihan, Lokey, Howard & Zukin.   "The proposed plan assumes an artificially depressed enterprise value of $493 million, when, in reality, the enterprise value is dramatically higher," the shareholder group said.   The shareholders said Silver Point is attempting to "present an artificially low valuation" to get control of the company's equity after bankruptcy.   Silver Point is asking the court to deny the Harbinger group's request for an expedited hearing on its request to form a committee, saying all parties in the case need time to review the Chanin valuation.   "It is premature for the Harbinger group to move this court to appoint a preferred equity committee," Luc Despins, an attorney for Silver Point, wrote in a letter filed with the bankruptcy court Friday.   Silver Point wants a Wednesday hearing on Granite's request to borrow an additional $20 million in bankruptcy financing - part of a $25 million debtor-in-possession loan approved on an interim basis last month - to go ahead as scheduled.   Silver Point is poised to take control of Granite when the broadcaster exits bankruptcy. The hedge fund, along with Granite's other bondholders, reached a deal before Granite sought Chapter 11 protection to trade the $295 million Granite owes them for the reorganized company's equity.   Under its proposed Chapter 11 plan, Granite's existing shares will be canceled and the reorganized company will issue 10 million new common shares, most of which are earmarked for secured creditors, namely Silver Point and the other bondholders. Silver Point is taking Granite private and the shares won't be publicly traded.   Preferred shareholders, who were owed about $300 million according to Granite's most recent quarterly financial statement, will receive a 2% stake in the new company. Based on Granite's own estimates, that stake will be worth about $5 million.   The Harbinger group claims Granite Chief Executive W. Don Cornwell is prepared to facilitate the "windfall" to Silver Point at the expense of shareholders in return for a "payoff in the form of all types of undue and improper consideration."   As reported, Cornwell stands to gain at least $2.6 million under the reorganization deal with Silver Point and the bondholders.   Under the proposed Chapter 11 plan, Granite will pay up to $2.5 million in income taxes owed on a forgiven loan the company made to Cornwell, who is a co-founder of Granite and sole holder of its voting shares.   Cornwell will also receive an equity stake worth an estimated $132,000 in the reorganized company and keep his job as CEO at a yearly salary of $629,200, which will double if the company meets its broadcast cash-flow target of $34.3 million. Cornwell will retain his seat on Granite's board and is eligible for stock options under a management incentive plan.   Conflicts also dog Granite's directors and senior management, who have agreed to be contractually bound to support the company's Chapter 11 reorganization plan, Harbinger said.   Harbinger said there's no group in the case watching out for the interests of the preferred shareholders or even for unsecured creditors. According to court papers, the U.S. Trustee's Office declined to appoint an official committee of unsecured creditors due to "insufficient creditor interest."   A committee to represent the holders of Granite's preferred stock is "necessary immediately to engage litigation before this court regarding the adequacy of the proposed disclosure statement and confirmability of the proposed plan," Harbinger said.   New York-based Granite Broadcasting filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection on Dec. 11, listing assets of $443.5 million and debts of $644.1 million. The company operates 23 television stations in seven states and employs 786 people.     -Marie Beaudette, Dow Jones Newswires; 202-862-1354; marie.beaudette@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 15:15 ET (20:15 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Waste Services Announces Completion of Florida Acquisitions and Credit Facility Amendment
Story: BURLINGTON, Ontario, Jan. 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Waste Services, Inc. (Nasdaq: WSII) today announced that it has completed the acquisition of the SLD construction and demolition waste landfill in Charlotte County, Florida and the Pro Disposal roll-off collection and transfer business, with operations in Collier and Lee Counties.  The landfill, which has a permitted capacity of 15.8 million cubic yards, commenced operations in December.  The company has also completed the previously announced amendment to its senior secured credit facility, which provided for an additional $100 million in term loans, as well as a reduction in the interest rate payable on all of the term loans to LIBOR plus 2.75%.     David Sutherland-Yoest, Waste Services Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, stated "We are excited by the prospects of these businesses in the southern Gulf coast area of Florida and are confident they will generate the $12 to $13 million of annualized EBITDA as previously indicated."     Waste Services, Inc., a Delaware corporation, is a multi-regional integrated solid waste services company that provides collection, transfer, disposal and recycling services in the United States and Canada.  The company's web site is http://www.wasteservicesinc.com.  Information on the company's web site does not form part of this press release.    SOURCE  Waste Services, Inc.       /CONTACT: Ivan R.
