Headline: INSINGER DE BEAUFORT: Euro Strength Unlikely To Last
Story: By Stephen Lewis     Of Insinger de Beaufort     LONDON (Dow Jones)--The New Year has opened with the euro flying high.   The foreign exchanges appear to take the view for 2007 that there is more upside for interest rates in the euro zone than in either the USA or Japan.  Further, business surveys are pointing to more robust trading conditions in the euro zone than in North America. International equity flows are probably favouring the euro over the US dollar.   At the same time, central banks around the world say they intend to diversify their foreign exchange reserves. Since central banks are currently holding more than twice as many dollars as euros, reserve diversification seems a major plus point for the euro. As banks and other currency market participants seek to position themselves for 2007, it is not surprising the euro should seem to them the safest bet.   Even so, euro strength is unlikely to extend far into 2007.   The IMF published fresh data on 29 December relating to the currency composition of central banks' reserves.  These showed that, at the end of 2006Q3, 65% of the reserves which the IMF could allocate to a specific currency were held in US dollars, with only 25% held in euros.  For central banks in industrial countries, the imbalance was even more extreme; 73% was in US dollars and 20% in euros.   Despite talk over the past two years of central banks switching reserves from dollars to euros, the US dollar's preponderance in 2006Q3 was, apparently, hardly less than at the end of 2004.  At that earlier date, the US dollar had accounted for 66% of total identified reserves while the euro proportion was 25%.   There is a puzzle here.  If central banks are diversifying their reserves, why are these proportions so stable?   Perhaps the answer lies in the data for developing countries' central banks, which include the figures for major reserve holders such as China, Russia and the oil-producing states. The reserves of these developing countries' central banks made up, in 2006Q3, 72% of aggregate global reserves.  Regarding these reserves, however, the IMF has been able to allocate to specific currencies only 53% of the total. From the end of 2004 to 2006Q3, the unallocated reserves of developing countries' central banks grew by 44%, equivalent to $484bn worth. Some of this increase may, in fact, have been in euro holdings.   Though the IMF data may, thus, be of limited value as a guide to reserve changes, the latest numbers do pick out some notable trends. The proportion of identified global reserves held in sterling continued to rise, reaching 4.3% as compared with 3.4% at end-2004. The Japanese yen, by contrast, was out of favour, with its share dropping from 3.9% at end-2004 to 3.2% by 2006Q3.   It appears central banks are not diversifying in mechanical fashion. They are looking at currencies other than the euro when seeking an alternative to the US dollar but are steering clear of those, like the yen, which seem to have negative fundamentals. The conclusion seems to be that central banks will build up euro holdings as long as they see independent factors to support the euro but will halt or reverse this process if the euro begins to look less well underpinned.   Economic fundamentals currently favour the euro but threats to the euro zone's economic stability are already on the horizon.  Chief among these is the divergence in economic performance between Germany and some other member-states and, in particular, France.   We identified this flaw in the euro's structure in our Economic Insights No 2649. Since then, the release of December purchasing managers surveys for manufacturing has underlined the point. The German composite index rose to a six-month 'high', whereas the French composite measure sank to a level not seen since last February.   The French business slowdown is occurring at an awkward time, only months ahead of a presidential election. French politicians have been railing against the euro's appreciation and the ECB's interest rate stance, while demanding more political input into euro zone financial policies. Though their complaints have met a sharp rebuff from German policymakers, they seem to have played well with the French electorate.   There will be no quick fixes for the French economy; it took several years of painful restructuring to lay the groundwork for corporate Germany's latest successes. Consequently, as the French economy continues to languish relative to the neighbouring German powerhouse, France's leaders are likely to become ever louder in their calls for reforms aimed at weakening the euro. Economic and political tensions within the euro zone are set to rise as the French election approaches. Even if the ECB stands firm and delivers the interest rate increases that the foreign exchanges are currently discounting, the howls of protest from Paris will draw attention to weaknesses in the euro zone economy, with potentially negative implications for the euro currency.   In any event, the US current account deficit is expected to turn the corner in 2007. The primary influence on the US trade balance is the USA's growth in domestic demand relative to the rest of the world. This has slowed dramatically since the end of 2006Q1. US final sales to domestic purchasers, the appropriate measure, grew in real terms by 4.0% in 2004 and by 3.6% in 2005 but by only 1.8% on average in 2006Q2-Q3.  The US domestic growth rate is now far below the IMF's projection of 4%-plus growth in global demand.  Weak US housing and slowing business investment are likely to keep overall domestic demand subdued in 2007. Against this background, the US current account should begin to improve. This is likely to bring a turn for the better in sentiment towards the US dollar.     -By Stephen Lewis: (+44) 20 7190 7193; sjlewis@insinger.com   (Stephen Lewis is chief economist at Insinger de Beaufort Ltd., London, independent brokers specializing in institutional business.)   Opinions expressed are those of the author, and not of Dow Jones Newswires.   This column is published for information only, and it neither constitutes, nor is to be construed as, an offer to buy or sell investments. The information and opinions expressed herein are based on sources the author believes to be reliable, but he cannot represent that they are accurate or complete. Any information herein is given in good faith, but is subject to change without notice. No liability is accepted whatsoever by Insinger de Beaufort Ltd., employees and associated companies for any direct or consequential loss arising from this article.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 07:06 ET (12:06 GMT)

Headline: : Alcone Marketing Group Hires Consumer Expert Beth Murphy for Alcone Consumer Lab(TM) Position
Story: DARIEN, Conn., Jan. 2 /PRNewswire/ -- Alcone Marketing Group announced that Beth Murphy has joined the agency as Director, Consumer Insights.  Murphy joins The Alcone Consumer Lab(TM), Alcone's in-house group that unearths and identifies leveragable insights into consumer behavior that fuel Alcone's Consumer Activation(TM) programs.     "The Alcone Consumer Lab is a unique agency concept, I'm excited to be a part of such a dynamic initiative," stated Murphy. Previous experience includes consumer insights work at Maybelline-Garnier and Canon USA.  Murphy will report to Jim Zembruski, EVP, Chief Marketing Officer in Alcone's Darien, CT office. Headline: : ASI Entertainment Inc. Announces Restructure
Story: ASI Entertainment Inc. Announces Restructure    SEATTLE--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 02, 2007--   ASI Entertainment, Inc. (OTCBB:ASIQ) announced today that the Company's Board has received and ratified a restructuring proposal received from the majority stockholders of the company. The restructuring will become effective December 31, 2006.       Under the restructure:       a. ASI Entertainment, Inc. ("ASI") will distribute all of the  ordinary shares of its subsidiary, ASIQ Pty. Ltd. ("ASIQ") to the  stockholders of ASI in the same proportion as their stockholding in  ASI.       b. Subsequent to the distribution of ASiQ shares, ASI will issue  32,216,664 shares of its common stock for $500,000.       c. ASI will acquire ASIQ's SafeCell Intellectual Property for  $250,000 under payment terms to be agreed, and will agree to write off  $1,800,000 debt owed to ASI by ASIQ.       On completion of the restructuring, ASI's subsidiary ASIQ will be  privatised. ASIQ provides in-flight connectivity solutions for airline  passengers and crew. ASiQ has contracts with Saudi Arabian Airlines  and Air One for its internet based systems.       ASI's business will then comprise the ownership of the SafeCell  Intellectual Property and will look to other synergistic investments.       SafeCell is an application for a patent of a new concept that  allows cell phones to be operated in-flight, without interfering with  the aircraft avionics and cellular ground networks.       ASI CEO, Mr Ron Chapman stated, "the restructuring is appropriate  under current market conditions as it will generate working capital  for both companies to further develop the products and programs, and  will result in the current ASI shareholders retaining their investment  in the airline communication business through ASIQ, as well as an  investment in the SafeCell Intellectual Property in ASI." Headline: : IKONICS Corporation Acquires Image Mate(TM) From Franklin International
Story: DULUTH, Minn., Jan. 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- IKONICS Corporation (Nasdaq: IKNX), a Duluth-based imaging technology company, announced today that on December 29, 2006, it acquired, from Franklin International of Columbus, Ohio, its Image Mate(TM) line of screen printing products.     For 2006, Image Mate sales are estimated to be $600,000. The Image Mate assets, including inventory, were purchased for $380,000 in cash, plus other considerations, including a long-term agreement to purchase key raw materials from Franklin International. The purchase was funded with available cash.     Bill Ulland, CEO at IKONICS, said that the acquisition will grow sales by bringing new and complementary products to the company's domestic Chromaline Screen Print Products division, as well as strengthen international offerings.     "Franklin International has done an admirable job of formulating and promoting the Image Mate line," Ulland said. "We look forward to advancing the brand by providing enhanced sales, marketing and product development support to the Image Mate distributor network."     All Image Mate production will be moved to Duluth; and employment offers have been made to two Image Mate employees. Additional manufacturing staff will be required in Duluth.     Evan Williams, President, and COO at Franklin International, expressed optimism in reaction to the Agreement: "This asset sale represents a great opportunity for Franklin's technology to find a more strategic home and for Franklin and IKONICS to thrive together in an important new relationship."     This press release contains forward-looking statements regarding sales, net earnings, and new products that involve risks and uncertainties. The Company's actual results could differ materially as a result of domestic and global economic conditions, competitive market conditions, acceptance of new products, the ability to identify and make suitable acquisitions, as well as the factors described in the Company's Form 10-KSB, Forms 10-QSB and other reports on file with the SEC. Headline: TALES OF THE TAPE: Cisco Faces Challenges Amid Growth
Story: By Mark Boslet     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     (This article was originally published Friday)     PALO ALTO, Calif. (Dow Jones)--Cisco Systems Inc. (CSCO) has been on a tear in recent months as network operators have increased their spending on new equipment, but topping these better results may not be easy as 2007 unfolds.   Telecos, cable companies and corporations that put off network upgrades since the lean years of the downturn have begun buying gear at a faster pace in recent quarters, adding capacity and preparing their networks for new demands, such as the expected crush of video on the Internet. Cisco, which supplies switches and routers that manage online traffic, saw its revenue rise 25% in its fiscal first quarter ended in October, or 16% excluding the $6.9 billion purchase last February of Scientific-Atlanta. It was the fastest growth in several years.   Cisco's stock has taken off as well, rising nearly 60% to $27.42 from $17.29 since late summer.   Expectations for the company, however, have grown, and there are signs key markets will show steady but not accelerating growth in the coming year. Investors who considered the San Jose-based vendor a 10% grower this summer now expect 15% or so. Keeping up the sales pace will be a big job for a company with $28.5 billion in annual sales despite the strong demand many see for networking equipment.   Cisco is a name synonymous with the high-tech bubble of 1999 and 2000. When traffic on the Internet jumped, network-service providers raced to build their online on ramps and the high-capacity network arteries that carry email and Web pages. When the equipment buying came to a  halt in 2001, so did Cisco's status as a growth company. The better results of the past couple quarters have brought the growth stock label back into vogue.   Cisco has become bullish on its prospects. "You're now going to see us get more aggressive and more bold," Chief Executive John Chambers told analysts earlier this month at the company's C-Scape 2006 conference. "We think the opportunity to be the major company in communications and IT is in front of us. We are very optimistic about the future."   During his address, Chambers said the markets Cisco serves are changing and accelerating faster than many people realize. To take advantage, Cisco has made product bets in key categories such as edge routing and Internet telephony.       Betting On Flagship Router     One bet is its latest flagship router - the CRS-1 - which recently emerged from a lengthy shakedown period during which service providers tested it and software bugs were repaired. Many of these customers have begun ordering the boxes, which can cost $1 million or more, leading order growth to surge over 500% in the first quarter.   Among the important trends Cisco sees taking place is the so-called "quadruple play," preparing networks to carry voice, video, data and link to mobile users with all sorts of devices. Service providers are moving in this direction as they anticipate the traffic onslaught of video and consolidate voice communications, video, data and in some cases high-definition television onto IP, or Internet protocol, networks.   At AT&T Inc. (T), for instance, "we're seeing a growing amount of traffic (and) we're operating on the assumption this is going to continue," says Jason Hillery, a spokesman. "There's been a good amount of (network expansion) activity this year."   To handle the demands of television and other services, "we're seeing a consolidation where all services are moving to IP" for efficiency, says Hillery. AT&T plans to shortly kick off a substantial upgrade to its network "core" with a new, faster 40 gigabits-per-second technology to quadruple capacity - an opportunity for the CRS-1. Product vendors have not been announced.   Corporations likewise are beginning to spend more freely on network equipment, creating a "$20 billion refresh cycle that we are just starting," says Nick Lippis, publisher of the Lippis Report, an industry newsletter. Along with looking at steering phone service over IP networks, companies are implementing a technology called power over ethernet, where networking devices transport not only data feeds but electrical power to simplify a building's wiring and to bring power to IP phones. Businesses are similarly consolidating data centers for efficiency and connecting them to higher speed networks.   The new demands play to Cisco's strengths in switches for corporations and routers for service providers.   "There are more opportunities for the company than a year ago," says Mark Sue, an analyst at RBC Capital Markets. "We consider Cisco a large-cap stock in a growth cycle."   Sue, who doesn't own stock in the company and whose firm doesn't conducting banking for Cisco, says he believes the company can grow at 15%, and he has a 12-month price target of $28, not far from where the stock trades now.       Higher Price Targets     Some investors suggest price targets will rise in coming quarters as Cisco increases its earnings.   "You can make an argument they are not that expensive based on their growth rate," says Douglas Whitman, president of Whitman Capital LLC of Menlo Park, Calif. With a price-to-earnings ratio of 28.8, the shares are relatively less expensive than those of Juniper Networks Inc. (JNPR) with a P/E of 32.4 and Extreme Networks Inc. (EXTR) with a P/E of 47.9.   Growth in some important Cisco markets, however, could moderate in 2007, making it difficult for the company to accelerate sales. In switching, Cisco's largest business, 2006 has been a solid year with world-wide sales growth of an estimated 10%, a slight boost from the 8% last year, according to Dell'Oro Group Inc. of Redwood City, Calif. Growth should temper slightly in 2007, to a 7% to 8% pace.   Cisco has benefited in the market by taking share from competitors such as 3Com Corp. (COMS) and Nortel Networks Corp. (NT), ending September with 72.8% of the market, up from just over 70% at the start of the year, says research firm Dell'Oro. The market-share gains should continue, says Cisco senior vice president Ian Pennell.   But a similar challenge could face the company in routing. The core router market should see global growth of 17% this year. Next year's expansion should be between 10% to 15%, says Dell'Oro. The market for edge routers - products from companies such as Juniper, Alcatel-Lucent (ALU) and Redback Networks Inc. (RBAK) that sit at the periphery of a network and regulate traffic to homes and businesses - should grow 32% this year and anywhere from 25% to 35% next year. Redback last week agreed to be sold to LM Ericsson Telephone Co. (ERIC).   Cisco has gained share in both markets, grabbing 58.6% of the core routing market as of September, up from 54.1% in March, while Juniper's share slipped to 31.9% from 36.9%, says Shin Umeda, vice president at Dell'Oro.   But rivals predict the gains won't continue. "Right now Cisco has a newer product in the (core) market place," says Shailesh Shukla, a vice president at Juniper. "Every new product gets some noise. This is not a sustainable thing."   (Mark Boslet is a special writer covering technology for Dow Jones Newswires.)   -By Mark Boslet, Dow Jones Newswires; 650-496-1366; mark.boslet@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 07:30 ET (12:30 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Friendly Ice Cream: Biglari Rejects 2 Bd Seats >FRN
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   Friendly Ice Cream Corp. (FRN) on Tuesday said dissident shareholder Sardar Biglari rejected the company's offer of two new board seats to avoid a proxy fight.   According to the Wilbraham, Mass., company, Biglari rejected the offer and demanded the company submit a proposal to shareholders on removing its three classes of directors.   Friendly said this amounted to Biglari demanding control of board.   Biglari controls 15% of Friendly's shares through various entities, and is chairman of Western Sizzlin Corp. (WSZL).   Friendly Chairman David Smith was recently named the target of a lawsuit from another shareholder, S. Prestley Blake, an 11.6% stakeholder.   -Andrew Edwards; 201-938-5400; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     Order free Annual Report for Friendly's Ice Cream Corp.  Visit http://djnewswires.ar.wilink.com/?link=FRN or call 1-888-301-0513  (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 16:45 ET (21:45 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Employees Sue ABB, Fidelity Over 401(k) Plan
Story: By Jilian Mincer     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     A lawsuit was filed last week against ABB Inc. and Fidelity Management Trust Co., alleging they overcharged employees participating in ABB's 401(k) retirement plan.   The lawsuit was filed Friday in the Western District of Missouri on behalf of ABB employees. Attorneys are seeking a class action certification for the case.   "We're alleging that both ABB and Fidelity are fiduciary and that excessive fees were charged to the plan and participants," said Jerome J. Schlichter, an attorney at Schlichter Bogard & Denton in St. Louis.   The firm has filed about a dozen similar suits since last fall against several major U.S. companies, including Lockheed Martin Corp. (LMT), General Dynamics Corp. (GD) and International Paper Co. (IP).   The suits contend that the 401(k) fees and expenses paid by the plans - and borne by employees - are too high and that the companies didn't disclose them properly.   At issue are rules under the Employee Retirement Income Act of 1974, a federal law that sets standards for private pension plans. ERISA requires that pension fees be reasonable and fully disclosed, and that they be charged solely for the benefit of the people in them.   "We disagree with many of the factual and legal assertions in the complaint, and we intend to defend the suit vigorously," said Vin Loporchio, a spokesman for Fidelity Investments.   He said the company does not comment on litigation or specific fee arrangements with clients, but "we believe that we provide valuable services to 401(k) clients for whom Fidelity serves as a record keeper and a trustee."   "ABB is aware of this complaint," said Ron Kurtz, a spokesman for ABB Inc., which has about 107,000 employees worldwide, including 8,500 in the U.S. "As this matter is now in litigation, I prefer not to comment at this time."   ABB manufactures equipment needed for the transmission and distribution of electric power; it also designs and develops automation technologies for industry. ABB Inc. is the U.S. unit of ABB Ltd. (ABB).   Many in the pension industry expect additional lawsuits against employers and 401(k) providers as the importance and availability of the retirement plans grows.   A recent Government Accountability Office report recommended that Congress amend rules governing 401(k) plans because the "piecemeal" disclosure of fees is hurting investors.   -By Jilian Mincer, Dow Jones Newswires; 201-938-4042; jilian.mincer@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 14:06 ET (19:06 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Mass. Regulator Probing UBS, Hedge Fund Trader Ties
Story: BOSTON (AP)--Massachusetts' top securities regulator is investigating whether leased office space and other services that investment bank UBS provides to hedge funds have created a conflict of interest that could hurt investors, a spokesman said Tuesday.   Secretary of State William Galvin has subpoenaed documents from UBS to determine whether hedge funds are paying higher than normal fees to UBS to compensate the bank for the office space in Boston and services including receptionists, said Brian McNiff, a Galvin spokesman.   At issue is whether such practices lead to higher management fees that investors pay the hedge funds, and whether those fees are disclosed to investors.   "He's looking at potential violations of securities laws, and a conflict of interest would be one of those," McNiff said.   McNiff said the investigation into what he called "hedge fund hotels" was at a preliminary stage, and it was too early to say whether the probe might lead to enforcement actions.   Rohini Pragasam, a spokeswoman for Switzerland-based UBS AG (UBS) in the bank's U.S. headquarters in New York, declined to comment Tuesday.   Galvin's probe was disclosed in stories in The New York Times and The Boston Globe on Tuesday.   The Times said Galvin was examining other banks with Boston office space leased to hedge funds to determine how they charged for their services, but the newspaper did not identify the other banks.   McNiff told The Associated Press he was aware only of Galvin's interest in UBS, which leases space to hedge fund traders in a downtown Boston office tower. The space comes with receptionists, espresso machines and consultants to manage information systems, the Times said.   The Times said UBS leases 400,000 square feet of space to hedge funds in a number of cities - a potential enticement to win more trading business from the hedge funds.   McNiff said Galvin's investigation involved only lease agreements in Massachusetts.   Hedge funds are an increasingly popular form of investing that operate under minimal government supervision but have recently come under greater scrutiny. U.S. hedge funds traditionally have catered to the rich, as well as pension funds and university endowments, but are increasingly luring less wealthy investors.   Unlike mutual funds, which generally hold stocks and bonds, hedge funds can invest in anything from commodities to real estate. Some funds even buy whole companies, while others buy and sell stocks like day traders - but with billions of dollars at stake.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 11:56 ET (16:56 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Cash Systems, Inc. Announces Christopher Larson to Leave Company
Story: LAS VEGAS--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 02, 2007--   Cash Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ: CKNN), a provider of cash access solutions for the gaming industry, today announced that Christopher Larson, Chief Operating Officer and a member of the Board of Directors, has resigned as an officer and board member of the Company.     Mr. Larson is leaving to become a co-founder, significant investor and Chief Financial Officer of CheckMate, a provider of financial services to the under-banked marketplace. Mr. Larson's resignation did not result from any disagreement with the Company concerning any matter relating to the Company's operations, policies or practices.     "While this was a difficult decision, I felt confident that Cash Systems was very well positioned for long-term growth with the right management, service offerings and technology that my transition could be near seamless," said Christopher Larson.     Michael Rumbolz, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Cash Systems, said, "We understand Chris' entrepreneurial desire and we wish him well in his new business endeavor."       About Cash Systems, Inc.     Cash Systems, Inc., located in Las Vegas, with additional offices in San Diego and Minneapolis, is a provider of cash-access and related services to the retail and gaming industries. Cash Systems' products include its proprietary cash advance systems, ATMs and check cashing solutions. Please visit http://www.cashsystemsinc.com for more information.     This press release may contain forward-looking statements, including the Company's beliefs about its business prospects and future results of operations. These statements involve risks and uncertainties. Among the important additional factors that could cause actual results to differ materially from those forward-looking statements are risks associated with the overall economic environment, the successful execution of the Company's plan of operation, changes in the Company's anticipated earnings, continuation of current contracts, gaming and other applicable regulations, and other factors detailed in the Company's filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, including its most recent Forms 10K and 10Q. Headline: : ARIAD to Webcast Presentation at the JPMorgan 25th Annual Healthcare Conference
Story: ARIAD to Webcast Presentation at the JPMorgan 25th Annual Healthcare Conference    CAMBRIDGE, Mass.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 02, 2007--   ARIAD Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (NASDAQ: ARIA) today announced that its presentation at the JPMorgan 25th Annual Healthcare Conference at the Westin St. Francis Hotel in San Francisco, California on Tuesday, January 9, 2007 will be webcast live and can be accessed by visiting the JPMorgan website at http://events.jpmorgan.com.       The presentation will be given at 8:00 a.m. (PST) by Harvey J.  Berger, M.D., chairman and chief executive officer of ARIAD, who will  provide an overview of the Company and its progress in key programs. A  replay will be available on the JPMorgan website approximately  twenty-four hours after the presentation and will be archived for two  weeks.       About ARIAD       ARIAD is engaged in the discovery and development of breakthrough  medicines to treat cancer by regulating cell signaling with small  molecules. The Company is developing a comprehensive approach to  patients with cancer that addresses the greatest medical need -  aggressive and advanced-stage cancers for which current treatments are  inadequate. Medinol Ltd. also is developing stents and other medical  devices that deliver ARIAD's lead cancer product candidate to prevent  reblockage at sites of vascular injury following stent-assisted  angioplasty. ARIAD has an exclusive license to pioneering technology  and patents related to certain NF-(kappa)B treatment methods, and the  discovery and development of drugs to regulate NF-(kappa)B  cell-signaling activity, which may be useful in treating certain  diseases. Additional information about ARIAD can be found on the web  at http://www.ariad.com.     Some of the matters discussed herein are "forward-looking statements" within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Headline: : BNSF Logistics Expands Through Acquisition of Pro-Am Transportation Services, Inc.
Story: SPRINGDALE, AR -- (MARKET WIRE) -- 01/02/07 --    BNSF Logistics, LLC announced today that it has acquired Pro-Am Transportation Services, Inc. (Pro-Am), of Jamestown, North Dakota. Pro-Am is a third-party logistics company (3PL) with approximately $25 million of revenue in 2006.  Specific terms of the acquisition were not disclosed.     The newly acquired company will operate within the Transportation ExecutionServices (TES) unit of BNSF Logistics.     "Pro-Am is an excellent operating company, with a large base of industrial business that is complementary to our portfolio, adding highly desired modal extension and depth," says Eric Wolfe, vice president and general manager of BNSF Logistics.     Dean Hafner, president and chief executive officer of Pro-Am, stated, "Maintaining a consistent operating philosophy is important to our customers and providing our employees with an avenue for rapid development and related opportunities is important to me.  I have been impressed with the BNSF Logistics team as they are people of integrity who are passionate about delivering overall value to their clients."     BNSF Logistics, which is an indirect wholly owned subsidiary of Burlington Northern Santa Fe Corporation (NYSE: BNI), provides customers with a comprehensive set of supply chain solutions ranging from management and execution of single shipment transactions to daily management of complex distribution and sourcing networks.  For more information about BNSF Logistics, visit its website at www.bnsflogistics.com.            Contact:  Richard Russack  (817) 867-6425     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 07:04 ET (12:04 GMT)

Headline: : QuadraMed Earns "Best in KLAS" Award In 2006 KLAS Year-End Report
Story: RESTON, Va.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 02, 2007--   QuadraMed(R) Corporation (Amex:QD) today announced that QuadraMed Affinity(R) has again been honored with a "Best in KLAS" award in the General Market Solutions "Acute Care Registration, Scheduling & Patient Accounting" category. This is the company's third consecutive award and fourth overall in this category. QuadraMed Affinity has received eight Best in KLAS awards since 1999.     The latest awards and product rating information are available in the 2006 "Top 20 Best in KLAS Awards" released this month. KLAS(R) product ratings are determined from detailed responses by healthcare providers as compiled over a 13-month period by KLAS Enterprises, LLC.     Acute Care Registration, Scheduling & Patient Accounting includes "products that provide some or all of inpatient 'core' systems in support of Patient Management (ADT), Patient Accounting (billing, A/R, contract management), Basic Scheduling, Medical Records and General Financials." Medium to large hospitals (over 200 beds) are targeted in this market segment.     In product ratings, QuadraMed MPI (Master Patient Index) earned the top rating for General Market Solutions in the EMPI category. This is the second consecutive first place finish for QuadraMed's patient identity management solution. Also, in the Community Hospital Solutions (facilities under 200 beds) "Community Clinical Ancillary Solutions" category, QuadraMed Pharmacy earned the number one rating from users of current products for the fourth consecutive KLAS Year-End report.     QuadraMed delivers comprehensive healthcare IT solutions that form the foundational components of the Care-Based Revenue Cycle(TM) process. This QuadraMed strategic process enables healthcare organizations to achieve improved financial performance by leveraging quality care into positive financial outcomes, while providing interoperability for the connected healthcare community and quality measurement.     More about KLAS Enterprises is available at www.healthcomputing.com. Further information about QuadraMed, its products and related services is available by visiting www.quadramed.com, or by calling 800-393-0278.       About KLAS Enterprises     Founded in 1996, KLAS is the only research firm specializing in monitoring and reporting the performance of healthcare information technology (HIT) vendors and products. KLAS strives to improve HIT delivery by independently measuring vendor performance for the benefit of consultants, investors, vendors, and healthcare provider partners. KLAS, in concert with thousands of healthcare executives and professionals, has created a dynamic database of HIT evaluations and opinions of healthcare executives, managers, and clinicians from over 4,500 healthcare facilities and 2500 clinics on 500+ HIT products from 175+ vendors. The Top 20 Report reflects the summary of HIT product performance data collected over a 13-month period. Headline: : Claymont Steel Holdings, Inc. Announces Full Redemption of 15 Percent Senior Secured Pay-In-Kind Notes Due 2010
Story: Claymont Steel Holdings, Inc. Announces Full Redemption of  15 Percent Senior Secured Pay-In-Kind Notes Due 2010       CLAYMONT, Del., Jan. 2, 2007 (PRIME NEWSWIRE) -- Claymont  Steel Holdings, Inc. (Nasdaq:PLTE) announced that it has notified the  Trustee for its outstanding 15% Senior Secured Pay-In-Kind Notes due  2010 (the "Notes") that it will redeem in full the $75,000,000  aggregate principal amount of the Notes plus the associated call  premium and accrued interest thereon, on February 1, 2007. The  redemption will be effected in accordance with the terms of the Notes  and the indenture governing the Notes at a redemption price of 110% of  the principal amount of the Notes plus accrued and unpaid interest. The  total redemption price of $88,906,250 will be funded through the net  proceeds from Claymont Steel's recent initial public offering of common  stock.       About Claymont Steel Holdings, Inc.       Claymont Steel manufactures and sells custom discrete steel  plate in North America. Claymont Steel's headquarters and manufacturing  facilities are located in Claymont, Delaware. More information is  available at http://www.claymontsteel.com. Headline: : Sun Life Financial appoints Venky Mysore as new country head for India
Story: TORONTO, Jan. 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ - Sun Life Financial (TSX/NYSE: SLF) today announced the appointment of Venky Mysore as Vice-President and Country Head, Sun Life Financial, India.     "We are delighted to welcome Venky to the Sun Life team," said Stephan Rajotte, President, Sun Life Financial Asia. "Venky brings a great deal of knowledge and experience to this role and we are pleased to have him on board as we continue to build and strengthen our business in India."     In this role, Mr. Mysore will be responsible for Sun Life Financial's investment in the Birla Sun Life joint venture companies, comprising three companies: Birla Sun Life Insurance Company Limited, Birla Sun Life Asset Management Company Limited and Birla Sun Life Distribution Company Limited. He will also be responsible for the ongoing relationship with the Aditya Birla Group. Sun Life Financial re-entered the Indian insurance market in 1999 through a joint venture with the Aditya Birla Group.     Mr. Mysore brings more than 20 years of experience in the insurance industry including experience in North America and in establishing operations in Asia. Mr. Mysore's involvement in the Indian insurance industry began when the government opened the insurance market to international players. During this time, he worked closely with regulators to help shape insurance regulations in the country. Mr. Mysore was most recently the CEO and Country Manager of MetLife India where he was instrumental in developing the India strategy, building the management team, establishing the distribution network and leading the product development process.     Birla Sun Life has seen tremendous growth since its beginnings. Birla Sun Life Asset Management is the seventh-ranked mutual fund company in India with CDN $3.9 billion assets under management (as of September 30, 2006). Birla Sun Life Insurance is one of the top five privately owned life insurers in the country (as of December 31, 2005), and as of September 30, 2006 had a sales force of 21,500 advisors in 116 branches serving 95 cities.     Mr. Mysore takes over from Gary Comerford, Vice-President, International and General Manager, India as he transitions back into a Corporate Office role as Vice-President and Managing Director, International, supporting Sun Life Financial's broader international interests.     "Gary's significant contributions to the business in India were a major factor in the success that we're enjoying with the Birla Sun Life joint venture," said Rajotte. "Gary's experience in establishing our India joint venture is of great value as Sun Life explores other international opportunities."        About Sun Life Financial     Sun Life Financial is a leading international financial services organization providing a diverse range of protection and wealth accumulation products and services to individuals and corporate customers. Chartered in 1865, Sun Life Financial and its partners today have operations in key markets worldwide, including Canada, the United States, the United Kingdom, Ireland, Hong Kong, the Philippines, Japan, Indonesia, India, China and Bermuda. As of September 30, 2006, the Sun Life Financial group of companies had total assets under management in excess of CDN$400 billion.     Sun Life Financial Inc. trades on the Toronto (TSX), New York (NYSE) and Philippine (PSE) stock exchanges under ticker symbol SLF.    SOURCE  Sun Life Financial Inc.       /CONTACT: Susan Jantzi, Senior Manager, External Communications & Corporate Affairs, (519) 888-3160, susan.jantzi@sunlife.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 14:13 ET (19:13 GMT)

Headline: Jean Coutu Tgt Boosted By RBC Ahead Of 2Q Results >PJC.A.T
Story: TORONTO (Dow Jones)--RBC Capital Markets increased its target price on Jean Coutu Group (PJC) Inc. (PJC.A.T) to C$16 from C$14.50, noting that next week's second-quarter earnings are expected to show strong contributions from the company's Canadian operations.   RBC analyst Irene Nattel said in a note that with the proposed Rite-Aid Corp. (RAD) transaction now expected to close shortly after Jean Coutu's third quarter, investors "should look through (the second quarter) EPS figure and focus on the profitability of the company's Canadian operations."   Jean Coutu is in the process of selling about 1,850 Brooks and Eckerd drugstores and six distribution centers in the U.S. to Rite Aid.   The RBC analyst noted that a strong underlying performance and favorable forex moves should drive Jean Coutu's results. RBC forecasts a 45% improvement in the company's second-quarter earnings to 16 Canadian cents a share, consistent with the second quarter of 2004, which is pre-Eckerd.   Jean Coutu is scheduled to report second-quarter results on Jan. 9.   RBC Capital Markets is providing Jean Coutu with non-securities services. The analyst or someone affiliated with the analyst holds shares in Jean Coutu.   Company Web site: http://www.jeancoutu.com   -Judy McKinnon; 416-306-2100; AskNewswires@dowjones.com       (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 12:11 ET (17:11 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : How Small Businesses with Equally Small Budgets Are Wooing Prospects Anywhere in the World
Story: Easy, Inexpensive Web Conferencing and Sales Tool from Citrix    Online Gives Every Business the Ability to Offer Dynamic Online                             Presentations  SANTA BARBARA, Calif.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 02, 2007--   Small businesses that need to attract widely dispersed customers now have an easy and affordable online alternative: Citrix(R) GoToWebinar(TM) by Citrix Online, a division of Citrix Systems, Inc. (Nasdaq:CTXS).     With only an Internet connection - and no training - GoToWebinar gives even the smallest organizations the ability to present online events with the same sophistication and impact as companies in the Fortune 500. The benefits include reduced sales cycles, increased customer satisfaction, money and time saved, and the ability to get back to core business activities more quickly.     MarketSharp, a small software and services provider to the home remodeling industry, turned to GoToWebinar when they needed a way to reach more customers and reduce the costs of training. "I always thought these tools were complicated and expensive," said Tim Musch, founder and director of business development at MarketSharp. "Then I heard about GoToWebinar 'all you can reach' pricing, making it simple to reach hundreds of people at once without any training. With GoToWebinar, we slashed our cost-per-sale by 50 to 75 percent and reduced customer turnover."     GoToWebinar is the first do-it-yourself Web conferencing solution for delivering presentations of up to 1,000 attendees per session. The on-demand service provides powerful interactive tools that engage audiences and enable presenters to gather feedback and receive questions in real time. GoToWebinar also gives presenters the ability to "see" if the audience is paying attention. This enables presenters to quickly engage the audience with online polls, or pick up the pace and change content, making their presentations more effective.     "No small business has extra time or money to waste, so being able to reach their audience with online presentations that really work is a significant competitive advantage," said Mike Mansbach, vice president of product marketing at Citrix Online. "Small businesses can derive proportionately larger gains from tools like this because when you're small every dollar and every hour count for more. These tools are ready for prime time."       GoToWebinar presentations:       --  Can be archived for 24/7 access, so remote attendees can          easily go back over something they missed or new customers can          teach themselves       --  Take attendees seconds to set up       --  Do not charge presenters for attendee minutes, unlike          competing products       --  Are available to presenters for an "All You Can Reach" flat          monthly fee       --  Reduce costs and time for travel, marketing, sales and          training       --  Provide the highest level of security     After a GoToWebinar session, Citrix(R) GoToMeeting(TM) can be used for follow up with smaller groups or individual users to reinforce training or close sales. GoToMeeting gives organizations the flexibility to conduct small online meetings while GoToWebinar provides large-scale events.     "I used to cringe when I heard the phrase 'Web conferencing,' whether I had to attend one or present one," said Musch. "But with GoToWebinar it's easy, affordable and the folks who attend my meetings love the convenience."     "Easy Web conferencing services that provide small- and mid-sized businesses with the added flexibility to obtain new business and streamline operations are at a competitive advantage," said Laurie McCabe, Vice President for SMB Insights and Business Solutions at Access Markets International (AMI) Partners, Inc. "Along with a simple approach that encourages everyday use, online collaboration services with affordable pricing will likely differentiate themselves in this market."     For more information on GoToWebinar and GoToMeeting, view the "How To Deliver More Interactive Demonstrations" Webinar by visiting: https://www.gotomeeting.com/s/Demo.       About Citrix GoToWebinar     Citrix GoToWebinar is the first do-it-yourself webinar solution so simple to use that anyone can conduct online events from their PC for sales, marketing and training purposes. "All You Can Reach(TM)" licensing includes planning, presentation and reporting functions for one flat fee with no hidden charges, bringing online events within reach of any size business. The user-friendly feature set supports up to 1,000 attendees per event. Designed specifically for webinars and larger online events, GoToWebinar combines ease-of-use performance with advanced security and industry-standard encryption for maximum privacy and data protection.       About Citrix     Citrix Systems, Inc. (Nasdaq:CTXS) is the global leader and the most trusted name in application delivery infrastructure. More than 180,000 organizations worldwide rely on Citrix to deliver any application to users anywhere with the best performance, highest security and lowest cost. Citrix customers include 100% of the Fortune 100 companies and 98% of the Fortune Global 500, as well as hundreds of thousands of small businesses and prosumers. Headline: : TD Banknorth Completes Acquisition of Interchange Financial Services Corporation - Expands Presence in Northern New Jersey
Story: PORTLAND, Maine--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 02, 2007--   TD Banknorth Inc. (NYSE: BNK) announced today that it completed its acquisition of Interchange Financial Services Corporation on January 1, 2007.     "The Interchange acquisition enhances our branch network in the Mid-Atlantic Region and significantly increases our presence in northern New Jersey," said William J. Ryan, Chairman and CEO of TD Banknorth Inc. "We're excited about expanding in Bergen and Essex counties and we look forward to meeting the financial needs of our newest customers."     Anthony J. Labozzetta, former Senior Executive Vice President and COO for Interchange, has joined TD Banknorth as Executive Vice President of Retail and Small Business banking. He will be responsible for the overall management and results of TD Banknorth's 180-branch network throughout the Mid-Atlantic.     "We're pleased to have someone of Tony's caliber coming on board to oversee retail distribution," said Wendy Suehrstedt, President and CEO of TD Banknorth's Mid-Atlantic Division. "His leadership will be invaluable as we continue to leverage our branch network in New Jersey, metro-New York and Pennsylvania."     Pursuant to the merger agreement, holders of shares of Interchange common stock are entitled to receive $23.00 in cash for each share outstanding. Letters of transmittal will be mailed to Interchange shareholders in early January for surrender of their stock certificates for payment.       About TD Banknorth Inc.     TD Banknorth Inc. is a leading banking and financial services company headquartered in Portland, Maine and a majority-owned subsidiary of TD Bank Financial Group. At September 30, 2006, TD Banknorth had $40 billion of total consolidated assets and provided financial services to nearly 1.6 million households in the Northeast. TD Banknorth's banking subsidiary, TD Banknorth, N.A., operates banking divisions in Connecticut, Maine, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania and Vermont. TD Banknorth and TD Banknorth, N.A. also operate subsidiaries and divisions in insurance, wealth management, merchant services, mortgage banking, government banking, private label credit cards, insurance premium financing and other financial services and offers investment products in association with PrimeVest Financial Services, Inc. The TD Banknorth common stock trades on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "BNK." For more information, visit http://www.TDBanknorth.com.        CONTACT: TD Banknorth Inc. Headline: : Haldex Sells Plant In Paris, Tennessee, USA to SETCO Automotive Limited, Mumbai, India for MSEK 33 (MUSD 4.9)
Story: STOCKHOLM, Sweden--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 02, 2007--   The sale concludes the previously announced shutdown of the plant in Paris, TN, one of Commercial Vehicle Systems' North American plants. The plant had 120 employees, accounted for sales of roughly MSEK 220, and mainly made compressors and assembled certain other products within the Air Management business unit.     The bulk of the production has been transferred to other Haldex (STO:HLDX) facilities in North America, and to China.     The sale to SETCO includes buildings, machinery and certain non-strategic product lines. The product lines sold account for roughly MSEK 60 in annual sales.     Haldex's earlier estimate of the net restructuring costs, MSEK 15, still stands, and has been allocated in Q3.     "This measure is part of our ongoing efforts to improve our cost structure," says Haldex President and Group CEO Joakim Olsson.     Haldex (www.haldex.com), headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, is a provider of proprietary and innovative solutions to the global vehicle industry, with focus on products in vehicles that enhance safety, environment and vehicle dynamics. Haldex is listed on the Stockholm Stock Exchange and has annual sales of nearly 8 billion SEK with 4,600 employees.     This information was brought to you by Waymaker http://www.waymaker.net        CONTACT: Haldex               Joakim Olsson, +46 8 545 049 54               or +46 70-545 86 54. Headline: : Caspian Services, Inc. Announces Plans to Construct Vessel Maintenance Facility
Story: ALMATY, Kazakhstan, Jan. 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Caspian Services, Inc. (OTC Bulletin Board: CSSV) announced today that it has entered into a Memorandum of Understanding to establish a vessel maintenance and repair facility with joint venture partners Nico International and Kazmortransflot JSC.  Nico International is a Dubai based international ship repair and ship building company with 30 years experience in the industry.  Kazmortransflot JSC is the State marine transportation company of the Republic of Kazakhstan.     John Scott, Chief Operating Officer of Caspian Services, commented, "We are pleased to be part of the joint venture with Nico International and Kazmortransflot to develop a key maintenance facility on the Caspian Sea.  We believe their interest in becoming our partners in this joint venture confirms our belief in the important contribution that marine repair and maintenance services will provide to the rapidly developing offshore oil and gas industry in the Kazakh sector of the Caspian Sea."     The maintenance facility will be built on the site of the marine base currently under development by Caspian Services at the port of Bautino on the Caspian Sea coast of Kazakhstan and the joint venture will become the first tenant operating at Caspian Services' Bautino marine base.  The maintenance facility will be designed to provide dry docking and floating repair capabilities for vessels up to 60 meters in length and 600 tons.  The maintenance facility will also have the capability to dry berth eight vessels at a time.  Nico International will provide the operational management of the maintenance facility on behalf of the joint venture.     Caspian Services, Inc. is an oilfield service company providing a broad range of services in the Caspian Sea region of western Kazakhstan.  The Company provides geophysical and seismic data acquisition and interpretation services; maintains a fleet of vessels that it commissions to oil and gas exploration companies engaged in exploration and development activities in the north Caspian Sea and other oilfield services such as lodging and desalinated water in the Port of Bautino.  The Company maintains corporate offices in Almaty and Aktau, Kazakhstan and Salt Lake City, Utah          For Further Information Please Contact:        Terrance J. Headline: MARK TO MARKET: What's The Real Deal In Atlantic City?
Story: By Jim Murphy   A Dow Jones Newswires Column     NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--It sounds fishy to me.   The city council of Atlantic City was a mortal lock to vote last week to ban smoking on the gambling floors of all city casinos.   Friday, we learned that the city council had delayed the vote until Jan. 24, and that the ban would now go into effect on April 15, which is about two and one-half months later than expected.   We were told by the politicians that the delay was taken to give the casinos more time to come into compliance with the new law.   The casinos were hardly grateful for the extra time. They said they would fight the ban in court when it goes into effect.   Why did the casinos need extra time to remove ashtrays from gambling areas? I could see the casinos getting extra time if a law was passed to mandate smoking and they had to go out and buy ash trays.     KNOCK, KNOCK.   "Yes?"   "Mr. Murphy, this is officer Hanratty of the Jersey City Environmental Squad. The city has banned wood-pulping machines in apartments effective today. But we're going to give you an extra week to get the machine out of your apartment."   "But, Officer Hanratty, I don't have a wood-pulping machine in my apartment."   "Very well then, Mr. Murphy. We'll give you a week to get one so you'll have something to remove."   Also, what special grounds can the casinos have for getting the smoking ban overturned when already it's state law in New Jersey bars, restaurants and bowling alleys?     "You don't understand, Your Honor. The pressure of squandering mortgage money and money for the kids' education puts enormous weight on the shoulders of casino gamblers, which can only be alleviated by lighting up one cigarette after the other."     Ruthie and I have not smoked for more than three and one-half years so we don't personally care what the casinos do or get away with not doing when we make our bimonthly excursions to Atlantic City.     Me & Shep     When I was in the Drama Society at Holy Cross College, I landed the smallest part in the "Fantasticks," which was "The Man Who Dies." I had a total of five lines which were spoken in a single burst.   Paul Freeman, a classmate who was doing the "Playbill" for the performance began my brief bio with "This mercurial meteorite..."   This did not sit well with at least one other cast member who wondered how he was the co-star and I had five lines and yet I, not he, was "this mercurial meteorite."   He hadn't figured out yet, as Paul and I had, that most of life was BS anyhow. For all it mattered I could have been referred to as "This pusillanimous planetoid ..."    I was reminded of my Playbill listing for The Fantasticks when I Googled Shepard Smith, anchor for FOX Cable News.   An official Web Site referred to Mr. Smith as "the vibrant and always colorful Shepard Smith," which phrase possesses a Balderdash Quotient at least as high as "this mercurial meteorite." The difference is that both Paul Freeman and I were having fun. Whereas, at FOX, someone believes they wrote something.   You know what I like about the people who give you the news in Britain? They are not oversold. They are referred to as news readers. "Felicity is a news reader for the BBC," they say.   They do not over-promise over there. They promise us that Felicity can read and, by golly, by the end of the program(me) the assertion is borne out.   I'm assuming that Shepard Smith can read from a cue card but not ad lib.   Covering Gerald Ford's services in front of St. Margaret's Episcopal Church on Saturday, Mr. Smith delivered himself of this bon mot: "President Ford engendered the common man."   I'm assuming Mr. Smith wanted to say "epitomized," but I have no idea. He went smugly on from there.     Protect This!     Did you see where George Pataki, who was just replaced as governor of New York by Eliot Spitzer, requested and received a security detail of state troopers at a cost of at least $20,000 a week?   Few people outside New York State know who Mr. Pataki is. Fewer care. In the final year of his administration, he was off to Iowa and New Hampshire to beat his own drum for president of the United States in Aught Eight.   Mr. Pataki must have concluded, "Hey, I'm running for president. Therefore, I must be somebody. Therefore, I must need protecting."   Of greater interest to me, Mr. Pataki's request for protection by state troopers was approved by the new governor, Eliot Spitzer.   Mr. Spitzer talks the talk about shaping up New York State. He doesn't walk the walk. He could have begun his first term in a smashing fashion by asking Mr. Pataki when the request was filed, "Are you kidding me?"     MaliBooBoo     Today Chevrolet takes the wraps off its new Malibu, which will be available to the public in about one year.   The new Malibu is the reincarnation of two other Malibus, both of which met with a mixed reception from the general public years ago.   As Joseph B. White wrote in Tuesday's Wall Street Journal:     "Say `Chevy Malibu,' and some Americans think of a 1960s muscle car. Unfortunately for General Motors Corp., many more think, `rent-a-car.'   "Now, GM is unveiling a revamped look for the Malibu sedan, as part of a broad effort to convince people shopping for a car priced below $30,000 to pause on their march to Toyota Motor Corp. or Honda Motor Co. dealerships."     With the redesigned Malibu, Chevy seeks to grab some of the market taken by the Toyota Camry and the Honda Accord.   I am not, as you know, a marketing professional. But I do wonder why General Motors would choose Malibu as the name for a new sedan, which it hopes will challenge Toyota and Honda.   Why take a chance on a name that comes to market trailing clouds of mixed memories?   What not Chevy Thunder? Has that name been taken?     (Jim Murphy, resident iconoclast at Dow Jones Newswires and veteran observer of global business trends, can be reached at (201) 938-2145 or by e-mail at Jim.Murphy@DowJones.Com)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 13:30 ET (18:30 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Goodyear's US Workers Return To Work After 3-Month Strike
Story: AKRON, Ohio (AP)--Goodyear Tire & Rubber Co.'s (GT) U.S. workers returned to work Tuesday after a three-month strike against the world's third largest tire maker.   Jack Hefner, vice president of Steelworkers Local 2 in Akron, said Tuesday that workers were happy to be back. "Morale, I would say, is (they are) glad to be back to work," he said.   Workers at 12 plants in 10 states approved a three-year agreement Friday covering 14,000 employees that includes plans to close a Texas tire factory and creates a $1 billion health care fund for retirees. The contract was approved by all 12 locals and by the overall membership by a 2-to-1 margin.   The company said the pact will help reduce its costs by $610 million over three years and $300 million a year thereafter.   The company said it was looking forward to focusing on business.   "What we expect is that both Goodyear and its workers now get back to being one team," Goodyear spokesman Ed Markey said. "The focus is on serving the customer and beating the competition."   Goodyear is third among the world's biggest tire makers after Japan's Bridgestone Corp. (5108.TO) and France's Group Michelin (12126.FR).   While some workers said it will take time to mend wounds with management, others were optimistic about rebuilding their relationship with management.   "Overall when we get back in there, they're going to be happy for us to get in there," said John Rutherford, president of USW Local 843L in Marysville, Ohio. "I don't think they're going to be overbearing and slapping us back into shape. We're looking forward to getting back into the routine."   Rutherford held resentment only for temporary workers who filled their jobs for weeks. The strike began Oct. 5.   Goodyear ultimately agreed to put $1 billion into a health care fund for retired union workers' medical benefits, higher than the company's previous $660 million but less than the union's call for roughly double that amount.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 02, 2007 11:55 ET (16:55 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Argentina 1Q Stk Outlook: Market Momentum Should Continue
Story: By Serena Saitto     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     BUENOS AIRES (Dow Jones)--After gaining 36% in 2006 and updating its record high level throughout the last quarter, the Argentine benchmark Merval index is seen keeping its positive momentum in the first quarter of 2007.   According to analysts, however, the continuation of this market's trend will depend on Wall Street's performance and on interest rates decisions by the U.S. Federal Reserve in 2007.   "The market can still gain a lot in the first quarter as long as the U.S. stock market conditions stay positive and the Fed keeps its interest rates low," said Guido Denin, an equity analyst with Grupo SBS, a bank in Buenos Aires.   Analysts widely agree that the banking sector will keep on enjoying an upward trend, while the metals sector - which lagged other industries in the last quarter - should rebound from recent dips, despite a slight decline in global metals prices.   "Steel makers Acindar (ACIN.BA) and Siderar (ERAR.BA) should catch up with their peers in the U.S., whose shares rallied a lot recently," driven by a boom in the industry's mergers and acquisitions, said Denin. He has a buy recommendation on both stocks and has six Argentine pesos ($1.96) target price for Acindar, and ARS27 for Siderar.   On Tuesday, Acindar closed up 1.24% at ARS4.88, while Siderar gained 1% to ARS24.65.   Juan Jose Vazquez, an analyst with Bull Market Brokers in Buenos Aires, sees the Merval index poised to enjoy a gain of between 12% and 15% this year. He believes the government's anti-inflation strategy of sector-by-sector price controls and export restrictions will squeeze companies' profitability and weigh further on direct investments into Argentina.   Vazquez agreed that the banking sector will stay positive, and also likes t said he is more cautious on the energy sector, and recommends selling shares of power transporter Transener (TRAN.BA).   The government imposed price freezes on a number of utilities as a result of the country's dramatic economic crisis of 2002, and a number of analysts have said that they are unlikely to be removed during this election year.   Still, despite the government's distortive industrial policies, the market should benefit from the fifth consecutive year of economic rebound. Economists widely expects Argentina to grow by about 7%, after four years of economic growth above 8%.   All analysts agree that the trend of the Merval's bellwether Tenaris (TS), the world's largest steel tube maker, remains positive despite the extended rally it enjoyed during the last quarter.   "With the fourth quarter results, Tenaris will start consolidating U.S. tube maker Maverick into its accounts, and during 2007 it will start showing the synergies coming from the acquisition," said Vazquez.   The stock gained more than 15% in December, and closed Tuesday up 2.83% to ARS76.10.
